src: Hakikisha mkono wako umetulia iwezekanavyo huku ukicheza sauti zote kwa usahihi - pia jaribu usifanye misogeo yoyote isiyo muhimu kwa vidole vyako. Hivi, utajisumbua kidogo iwezekanavyo. Kumbuka hakuna haja ya kugonga vibonye kwa nguvu nyingi ili kutoa sauti kubwakama kwenye piano. Kwenye kodiani, kupata sauti ya ziada, unatumia viriba na shinikizo au kasi zaidi.
mt: 1. Make sure your hands are properly positioned as you play, and play all the notes accurately. 2. Don't make any unnecessary motions with your fingers. 3. Don't hit the keys too hard to get a softer sound. 4. To get a louder sound, use the sustain pedal or more force.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: Shida moja ya kawaida wakati wa kujaribu kubadilisha sinema kwenda kwa muundo wa DVD ni kuskani zaidi. Vipindi vingi vya televisheni nyingi hutengenezwa kwa njia ya kufurahisha umma. Kwa sababu hiyo, kila kitu mnachokiona kwenye runinga kilikatwa mipaka, juu, chini na pande. Hii hufanywa ili kuhakikisha picha inafunika skrini yote. Hiyo inaitwa kuskani kulikokithiri. Kwa bahati mbaya, unapotengeneza DVD, kuna uwezekano kingo zake zitakatwa pia, na kama video ilikuwa na maandishi ya tafsiri yaliyokuwa karibu sana na chini, pia hayataonyeshwa.
mt: A common problem when trying to convert VHS to DVD is that the video is cropped. Many TV shows are produced for the masses. Because of this, everything you see on the screen is cut off, top, bottom and sides. This is done to ensure that the picture fills the screen. Unfortunately, when you convert to DVD, there is a chance that the edges are cropped as well, and if the video had subtitles that were close to the bottom, they will not be shown.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: Mpango wa Marekani ulitegemea uanzishaji wa mashambulio yaliyoratibiwa kutoka pande tatu tofauti. Jenerali John Cadwalder alianzisha shambulio la kupotosha dhidi ya ngome ya Uingereza katika Bordentown, ili kuzuia usaidizi wowote. Jenerali James Ewing angewachukua wanamgambo 700 na kuvuka mto huko Kivukio cha Trenton, kutwaa kwa nguvu daraja iliyoko juu ya Asunpink Creek na kuwazuia wanamgambo wowote adui kutoroka. Kikosi kikuu cha ushambuliaji chenye wanaume 2,400 kilivuka mto maili tisa kaskazini mwa Trenton, kisha kugawanyika kwa vikundi viwili, kimoja chini ya Greene na kingine chini ya Sullivan, ili kuanzisha shambulio kabla ya macheo.
mt: The plan called for three simultaneous attacks. General John Cadwalder established a diversionary raid against the British garrison in Bordentown, to prevent any aid. General James Ewing took 700 troops and crossed the river at Trenton Falls, overran the bridge over Asunpink Creek and prevented any enemy from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men crossed nine miles north of Trenton, splitting into two columns, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, to begin the attack before dawn.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: Baada ya kukubaliwa na Kongresi mnamo Julai 4, rasimu iliyoandikwa kwa hati ya mkono na kutiwa sahihi na Rais wa Kongresi John Hancock na Katibu Charles Thomson ilitumwa vitalu vichache kwa duka la uchapishaji la John Dunlap. Usiku kucha kati ya nakala 150 na 200 zilitengenezwa, ambazo sasa zinajulikana kama “Vikaratasi vya Dunlop”. Usomaji wa kwanza kwa umma wa hati hiyo ulifanywa na John Nixon katika yadi ya Ukumbi wa Uhuru mnamo Julai 8. Moja ilitumwa kwa George Washington mnamo Julai 6, ambaye aliifanya isomewe vikosi vyake katika New York mnamo Julai 9. Nakala ilifika London mnamo Agosti 10. Nakala 25 za Dunlap zenye cheche za mashambulizi zinazojulikana kuwahi kuwepo ndizo nakala kongwe zaidi za hati hiyo zinazopatikana. Nakala asili iliyoandikwa kwa mkono haipo.
mt: After being approved by Congress on July 4, the document was written out in longhand and signed by President of Congress John Hancock and Secretary Charles Thomson and sent to the printing office of John Dunlap. A few hours later, between 150 and 200 copies were produced, which are now known as the “Dunlap broadsides”. The first public reading of the document was performed by John Nixon in the Old State House on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. The document arrived in London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides with bullet holes known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten document is not known to exist.
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: Wakoloni, walipoona shughuli hii, pia waliita wasaidizi. Majeshi yanayoimarisha nafasi za mbele ni pamoja na ya 1 na ya 3 ya majeshi ya New Hampshire yaliyo na wanaume 200, yaliyo chini ya makanali John Stark na James Reed (ambao baadaye wote walikuwa majenerali). Wanaume wa Stark walichukua nafasi kando ya uzio upande wa kaskazini mwa nafasi ya Mkoloni. Wakati kupwa kwa maji kulifungua mwanya katika Mto Mystic katika kaskazini mashariki mwa rasi, waliendeleza ua kwa haraka kwa ukuta mfupi wa mawe upande wa kaskazini na kuishia kwenye ukingo wa maji katika pwani ndogo. Gridley au Stark aliweka nguzo umbali wa kama futi 100 (mita 30) mbele ya uzio na akaamuru kwamba hakuna atakayeiwasha moto hadi watu wa kawaida watakapokuwa wameipita.
mt: When the colonists saw this, they also called for assistance. The regiments that were forming the front line included the 1st and 3rd regiments of the New Hampshire militia, which had 200 men under the command of Colonel John Stark and James Reed (both of whom later became generals). The men of Stark took position on the north side of the line of battle. When the water began to open the way in the Mystic River in the northeast corner of the peninsula, they pushed forward quickly through a narrow rock wall on the north side and ended up at the mouth of the river in the small bay. Gridley or Stark placed a bridge about 100 yards (30 m) in front of the line and ordered that no one would extinguish the fire until the common people had passed through.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: Uchina ya kale ilikuwa na njia ya kipekee ya kuonyesha vipindi tofauti vya wakati; kila hatua ya Uchina au kila familia iliyokuwa mamlakani ilikuwa nasaba maalumu. Pia kati ya kila nasaba kilikuwa kipindi kisicho na msimamo cha majimbo yaliyogawanyika. Maarufu sana kati ya vipindi hivi ilikuwa enzi za Falme Tatu za ya Han na Jin. Wakati wa vipindi hivi vita vikali vilifanyika kati ya waangwana wakipigania kiti cha enzi. Falme Tatu ilikuwa enzi yenye umwagaji damu zaidi katika historia ya China ya Kale, maelfu ya watu walikufa wakipigania kuketi kwenye kiti cha juu zaidi katika ikulu ya Xi'an.
mt: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different periods of time; each dynasty or family in power had its own era. Also, within each era, there were different reigns, which were divided into different years. One of the most famous of these eras was the Three Kingdoms era of Han and Jin. During these eras, major wars were fought between warlords vying for the throne. The Three Kingdoms era was one of the bloodiest in Chinese history, with millions of people dying in the struggle for the top seat in the imperial palace of Xi'an.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: Makoloni ya siafu huandamana na kuishi katika awamu tofauti vilevile. Katika awamu ya kuhamahama, siafu huandamana usiku na kusimama na kukita kambi mchana. Koloni huanza awamu ya kuhamahama wakati chakula kilichopo kimepunguka. Katika awamu hii, koloni hutengeneza viota visivyo vya kudumu ambavyo hubadilishwa kila siku. Kila moja haya mabwawa ya kuhamahama au maandamano hudumu takriban siku 17.
mt: Ant colonies are organized into different layers. In the foraging layer, ants spend the night and form a sleeping cluster during the day. The colony begins the foraging layer when food is depleted. In this layer, the colony constructs temporary nests that are changed daily. Each of these foraging layers or clusters lasts about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: Wengi walifuata mtindo katika fiziolojia na tabia ambazo mara nyingi hutegemea uwepo wa vipindi vya kiasili na uzalishaji wao kupitia mida za kibiolojia. Midundo ya mara kwa mara, ambayo si jibu tu kwa ishara za nje za mara kwa mara, imerekodiwa kwa viumbe wengi wenye uhai, zikiwemo bakteria, kuvu, mimea na wanyama, Saa za kibiolojia ni osileta zinazojimudu ambazo zitaendeleza kipindi cha ujiendeshaji wa mzunguko hata pasipo na vidokezo vya nje.
mt: Many follow a pattern in physiology and behavior that often depends on the presence of natural cycles and their production through biological rhythms.  Circadian rhythms, which are not just a response to external cues, have been recorded in many living organisms, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals, Biological clocks are oscillators that will continue to run in the absence of external cues.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: Idadi ni mkusanyiko wa viumbehai wa spishi maalum ndani ya eneo fulani la kijiografia. Wakati kila mmoja katika idadi ya wakazi ni sawa kwa kuzingatia tabia fulani ya maumbile wanajulikana kama wanajinsia moja. Wakati watu wanaonyesha tofauti kadhaa za tabia fulani wanasemekana kuwa polimofiki.
mt: A population is a collection of individuals of the same species living in a particular area. When each individual in a population is the same age, it is called a monomorphic population. When individuals in a population show different age-specific characteristics, it is called a polymorphic population.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Utalii wa asili huvutia watu walio na nia ya kutembelea maeneo ya asili kwa sababu ya kuburudishwa na maadhari, pamoja na mimea na wanyama. Mifano ya shughuli za eneoni ni pamoja na uwindaji, uvuvi, upigaji picha, kutazama ndege, na kutembelea mbuga na kusoma habari za mfumo wa ikolojia. Mfano ni kutembelea, kupiga picha, na kujifunza juu ya nyani wakubwa huko Borneo.
mt: Original tourism draws people with the intention of visiting natural areas because of their beauty, flora and fauna. Examples of activities are hunting, fishing, taking pictures, watching birds, and visiting parks and reading about the ecological system. An example is visiting, taking pictures, and learning about the large orangutans in Borneo.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: Kila asubuhi, watu huondoka miji midogo mashambani ndani ya magari wakielekea kazini wakipitana na wengine ambao wanaelekea kazini walikotoka wao. Katika chombo hiki imara cha usafiri, kila mtu kwa njia fulani ameunganishwa na, na kuunga mkono, mfumo wa usafiri unaotegemea magari ya kibinafsi. Sayansi sasa inaashiria kuwa uchumi huu mkubwa wa kaboni umeondoa nyanjahai ya dunia kutoka mojawapo ya hali zake imara ambayo ilipaswa kushikilia mageuzi ya mwanadamu kwa miaka milioni mbili iliyopita.
mt: Every morning, people leave small towns for the countryside in their cars, passing others who are also going to work. In this reliable mode of transportation, each person in some way is connected to, and supports, a carbon-based economy. Science now suggests that this major carbon economy has pulled the world out of one of its most stable states that should have held humanity's evolution for millions of years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: Atomu inaweza kuchukuliwa kama mojawapo ya mawe msingi ya ujenzi ya dutu zote. Ni chombo tata ambacho kulingana na mfano uliorahisishwa wa Bohr, kina nyuklia ya kati inayozungukwa na elektroni, sawa na sayari zinavyozunguka jua - ona Mchoro 1.1. Nyuklia ina chembe mbili - nyutroni na protoni. Protoni zina chaji chanya ya umeme wakati neutroni hazina chaji. Elektroni zina chaji hasi ya umeme.
mt: An atom can be thought of as one of the basic building blocks of all matter. It is a subatomic particle, according to the Bohr model, consisting of a positively charged nucleus surrounded by negatively charged electrons - see Figure 1.1. Atoms have two parts - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electrical charge while neutrons have no charge. Electrons have a negative electrical charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Karibu kompyuta zote zinazotumika leo zimekitwa katika kuendeshwa kwa habari ambayo imewekwa katika msimbo ulio katika hali ya nambari za bainari. Nambari ya bainari yaweza tu kuwa na thamani moja kati ya mbili, yaani 0 au 1, na hizi nambari zinajulikana kama takwimu jozi, au biti, katika msamiati wa kompyuta.
mt: All computers used today are controlled by information that is stored in a binary digit, or bit. A bit can have only one of two values, 0 or 1, and these values are known as binary digits in computer memory.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: Karibu kompyuta zote zinazotumika leo zimekitwa katika kuendeshwa kwa habari ambayo imewekwa katika msimbo ulio katika hali ya nambari za bainari. Nambari ya bainari yaweza tu kuwa na thamani moja kati ya mbili, yaani 0 au 1, na hizi nambari zinajulikana kama takwimu jozi, au biti, katika msamiati wa kompyuta.
mt: All computers used today are controlled by information that is stored in a binary digit, or bit. A bit can have only one of two values, 0 or 1, and these values are known as binary digits in computer memory.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: "Blogi pia zinaweza kuimarisha uandishi wa mwanafunzi. Huku wanafunzi wakianza tajriba yao ya blogi na matatizo ya sarufi na herufi, uwepo wa hadhira kijumla hubadilisha hilo. Kwa kuwa wanafunzi ndio hadhira muhimu zaidi, mwandishi wa blogu huanza kujitahidi kuboresha uandishi ili kuzuia kukosolewa. Uandishi blogi pia ""hulazimisha wanafunzi kuwa wajuzi wa ulimwengu unaowazunguka."" Hitaji la kutosheleza ari ya hadhira huwachochea wanafunzi kuwa werevu na wenye kuvutia (Toto, 2004). Uandishi blogi ni kifaa kinachochochea ushirikiano, na kuhimiza wanafunzi kupanua usomaji zaidi ya siku ya kawaida ya masomo shuleni. Utumiaji mwafaka wa blogu “unaweza kuwawezesha wanafunzi kuwa wachambuzi na wa kushutumu zaidi; kupitia kujibu nyenzo za Intaneti kiamilifu, wanafunzi wanaweza kuaini nafasi zao katika muktadha wa maandiko ya wengine vilevile kuelezea mitazamo yao wenyewe kuhusu masuala maalum (Oravec, 2002)."
mt: "Blogs can also improve student writing. As students begin their blogging experiments with spelling and grammar issues, the presence of an audience as a whole changes that. Because students are the most important audience, the blog writer begins to improve his or her writing to avoid embarrassment. Blog writing also ""forces students to be world-wise."" The need to address an audience demands that students be interesting and relevant (Toto, 2004). Blog writing is a tool that encourages collaboration, and encourages students to expand their reading beyond the typical school day. The use of a blog ""can help students become more critical and self-correcting; through responding to Internet postings at their most intense, students can identify their place in the writing of others as well as express their own views on specific issues (Oravec, 2002)."
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Mawasiliano mengi ya kisolandanifu huchochea muda wa kutafakari na kuitikia wengine. Huwaruhusu wanafunzi uwezo wa kufanya kazi kwa mwendo wao wenyewe na kudhibiti mwendo wa taarifa za mafundisho. Isitoshe, kuna vizuizi vichache vya saa na uwezekano wa saa huru za kufanya kazi. (Bremer, 1998) Matumizi ya intaneti na Wavuti wa Ulimwengu Wote unaruhusu wanafunzi kupata habari kila wakati. Wanafunzi wanaweza pia kupeleka maswali kwa waalimu wakati wowote wa siku na wanatarajia majibu ya haraka, badala ya kungojea mkutano wa uso-kwa-uso utakaofuata.
mt: Many asynchronous communications allow time for reflection and response. They allow students to work at their own pace and control the pace of instruction. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows students to access information at any time. Students can also ask questions of instructors at any time of day and expect quick responses, rather than waiting for a face-to-face meeting.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: Kasri la kiasili la zama za kati lilichochea dhana, na kuleta picha za mashindano ya kivita, karamu na uungwana wa Kiartha. Hata kwa kusimama katikati mwa magofu ya miaka elfu ni rahisi kuwa na taswira ya sauti na harufu ya vita vilivyopita kitambo, na karibu kusikia mlio wa kwato kwenye barabara za mawe na kunusa uoga kutoka kwenye jela za chini kwa chini. Lakini fikira zetu zina misingi ya ukweli? Mbona ngome zilijengwa pale mwanzoni? Zilibuniwa na kujengwa vipi?
mt: A natural history of the middle ages, which brought to mind images of tournaments, feasts and the unity of Arther. Even standing in the midst of the ruins of a thousand years is easy to imagine the sounds and smells of war, and almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobblestone streets and the stench of the dungeons below. But our thoughts have a basis in fact? Why were the castles built there in the first place? Who built them and how?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: Kwa kawaida ya kipindi hicho, Ngome ya Kirby Muxloe ni zaidi ya nyumba ambayo imeimarishwa kuliko ngome ya kweli. Madirisha yenye glasi kubwa na kuta nyembamba hazingeweza kupinga shambulio kwa muda mrefu. Katika miaka ya 1480, wakati ujenzi wake ulipoanzishwa na Bwana Hastings, nchi ilikuwa yenye amani kiasi na ulinzi ulihitajika tu dhidi ya vikundi vidogo vya wanyang’anyi.
mt: Normally at this time, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a house than a real castle. Large glass windows and thin walls can withstand an attack for a long time. In the year 1480, when its construction was started by Mr. Hastings, the country was at peace and protection was needed only against small bands of bandits.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Kwa mabadiliko kutoka mbio za robo hadi nusu maili, kasi huwa yenye umuhimu mdogo zaidi na ustahimilivu ukawa hitaji lenye umuhimu kabisa. Kwa kweli mkimbiaji wa daraja la kwanza wa nusu maili, mtu anayeweza kufuzu kwa dakika mbili, lazima awe na kasi ya kutosha, lakini uvumilivu lazima ustawishwe wakati wote wa hatari. Mbio kiasi za mashambani katika msimu wa baridi, pamoja na shughuli katika ukumbi wa mazoezi kwa ajili ya sehemu ya juu ya mwili, ndiyo maandalizi bora ya msimu wa mbio.
mt: For a change from the 400-meter dash to the 400-meter hurdles, speed is less important and endurance is essential. In fact, the first 400-meter hurdler to qualify in two minutes, someone who can run the 400 meters in two minutes, must have the speed, but endurance must be maintained at all times of danger. Country running in the winter season, along with training in the gym for the upper body, is the best preparation for the season.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Mazoea ya lishe sahihi pekee haiwezi kuzalisha usomi wa utendaji, ila yanaweza kuathiri kwa kiasi kikubwa na ustawi wa wakimbiaji wachanga kwa ujumla. Kudumisha uwiano bora wa kawi, kuwa na mazoea ya unywaji wa maji yenye ufanisi, na kuelewa vipengele tofauti vya mazoea ya ziada kunaweza kusaidia wanariadha kuboresha utendaji wao na kuongeza raha yao katika spoti hiyo.
mt: A healthy diet alone cannot produce performance enhancement, but it can significantly and positively affect the overall well-being of young athletes. Maintaining a proper balance of intake, having efficient hydration, and understanding the different aspects of additional supplements can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment in that sport.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: Mbio za umbali wa kati ni spoti isiyo ghali sana; hata hivyo, kuna dhana nyingi potovu kuhusu zana chache zinazohitajika ili kushiriki. Bidhaa zinaweza kununuliwa zinapotakikana, lakini nyingi zitakuwa na athari ndogo au isiyo halisi kwa utendaji. Wanariadha wanaweza kuhisi wanapendelea bidhaa hata kama haina manufaa halisi.
mt: Mid-range distances are cheap; however, there are many myths about the few tools required to participate. Items can be purchased when needed, but many will have little or no real effect on performance. Athletes can feel they are benefiting even if they are not.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: MRI ni ya msingi wa fizikia inayoitwa nyuklia mwangwi wa sumaku (NMR), ambayo iligunduliwa katika 1930s na Felix Bloch (anayefanya kazi katika Chuo Kikuu cha Stanford) na Edward Purcell (kutoka Chuo Kikuu cha Harvard). Katika tasnifu hii, uga wa sumaku na wimbiredio husababisha atomi kutoa ishara ndogo za redio. Katika mwaka wa 1970, Raymond Damadian, daktari wa kimatibabu na mtafiti wa kisayansi, aligundua msingi wa kutumia picha za mwangwi wa sumaku kama kifaa cha utambuzi wa kimatibabu. Miaka minne baadaye leseni ilitolewa, ambayo ilikuwa leseni ya kwanza ulimwenguni iliyotolewa katika sehemu ya MRI Mwaka wa 1977, Dak. Damadian alikamilisha ujenzi wa mdaki wa MRI wa mwili wote ambao aliuita “kisicho epukika”.
mt: 1. MRI is a basic physical phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this process, the magnetic field and radio frequency cause atoms to emit small radio signals. In 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and scientist, discovered the basis of using magnetic resonance imaging as a medical diagnostic tool. Four years later, a patent was granted, which was the first patent issued worldwide in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of a whole-body MRI scanner which he called “non-invasive”.
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: Kwa umbali wanadamu ndio spishi yenye talanta zaidi katika kusoma akili za wengine. Hilo linamaanisha tunaweza kutabiri kile binadamu wengine wanachohisi, kukusudia, kuamini, kujua au kutamani kwa ufanisi. Katika uwezo huu, kuelewa nia ya wengine ni muhimu. Huturuhusu kutatua uwezekano wa utata katika vitendo halisi vya kimwili. Kwa mfano, ikiwa ungeona mtu akivunja dirisha la gari, labda ungedhani alikuwa anajaribu kuiba gari la mtu usiyemjua. Angehitaji kuhukumiwa tofauti ikiwa angepoteza funguo za gari lake na lilikuwa gari lake mwenyewe ambalo alikuwa akijaribu.
mt: Humans are the species with the greatest ability to read the minds of others. This means we can predict what others are feeling, thinking, believing, knowing, or desiring with accuracy. Understanding the intentions of others is important. It allows us to resolve ambiguities in physical actions. For example, if you saw someone breaking a car window, you might think they were trying to steal a car. They would be guilty of a different crime if they were throwing away the keys to their own car that they were trying to break into.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

Huturuhusu kutatua uwezekano wa utata katika vitendo halisi vya kimwili. Kwa mfano, ikiwa ungeona mtu akivunja dirisha la gari, labda ungedhani alikuwa anajaribu kuiba gari la mtu usiyemjua. Angehitaji kuhukumiwa tofauti ikiwa angepoteza funguo za gari lake na lilikuwa gari lake mwenyewe ambalo alikuwa akijaribu.
mt: Humans are the species with the greatest ability to read the minds of others. This means we can predict what others are feeling, thinking, believing, knowing, or desiring with accuracy. Understanding the intentions of others is important. It allows us to resolve ambiguities in physical actions. For example, if you saw someone breaking a car window, you might think they were trying to steal a car. They would be guilty of a different crime if they were throwing away the keys to their own car that they were trying to break into.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: Ingawa Akili Bandia inahusishwa sana na tungo za kisayansi, Akili Bandia huunda sehemu muhimu sana ya tawi la sayansi ya kompyuta, kushughulikia tabia, mafunzo na marekebisho ya akili kwa mashine. Utafiti katika Al unajumuisha kutengeneza mashine za kufanya kazi zinazohitaji tabia za busara kuwa otomatiki. Mfano ni pamoja na kudhibiti, kupanga na kuratibu, uwezo wa kujibu utambuzi na maswali ya wateja, pamoja na utambuzi wa maandishi, sauti na uso. Mambo kama hayo yamekuwa taaluma tofauti, zinazotazamia kutoa suluhu kwa shida za maisha. Mfumo wa AI sasa hutumiwa mara nyingi katika nyanja za uchumi, dawa, uhandisi na jeshi, kama ulivyojengwa katika programu kadhaa za kompyuta za nyumbani na michezo ya video.
mt: While Artificial Intelligence is often associated with science fiction, AI plays a crucial role in the field of computer science, dealing with intelligence of machines that can be programmed to think like humans and mimic their actions. The study of AI includes such applications as planning, scheduling, control, decision making, and learning. These have been traditionally the domain of artificial intelligence, which seeks to solve the problems of life. AI is now widely used in business, medicine, engineering, and the military, as seen in many home computer programs and video games.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Mifumo inayobadilika ya fikira ni mbinu za utatuzi wa shida ambazo zinaunganisha maoni au nyanja tofauti ili kupata suluhisho. Angazio la mtazamo huu ni kasi, mantiki na usahihi, pia utambuzi wa ukweli, kutumia tena mbinu zilizopo, kukusanya taarifa. Kipengele muhimu zaidi cha mtazamo huu ni: kuna jibu moja tu sahihi. Unafikiria majibu mawili tu, yaani sahihi au kosa. Aina hii ya fikira inahusishwa na taratibu fulani za kisayansi au kawaida. Watu wenye aina hii ya kufikiria wana mawazo ya kimantiki, wanaweza kukariri miundo, kutatua shida na kufanya majaribio ya kisayansi.
mt: This type of thinking is characterized by some scientific or common procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thoughts, can design systems, solve problems, and conduct scientific experiments.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: Matumizi ya video za kurekodi imesababisha uvumbuzi muhimu katika tafsiri ya sauti ndogo, kusongeshwa kwa uso ambao hudumu sekunde ndogo kadhaa. Hususan, inadaiwa kuwa mtu anaweza kutambua ikiwa mtu anadanganya kwa kufasiri ishara ndogondogo kwa njia sahihi. Oliver Sacks, katika gazeti lake Hotuba ya Rais, alionyesha namna watu ambao hawawezi kuelewa hotuba kutokana na uharibifu wa ubongo hata hivyo wana uwezo kwa kutathmini ukweli kwa usahihi. Hata anapendekeza kwamba uwezo kama huo wa kufasiri tabia za binadamu unaweza kushirikishwa wanyama kama vile mbwa wa kufugwa.
mt: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of small sounds, such as lip reading which can be done for a few seconds. Especially, it is claimed that a person can recognize if someone is lying by correctly interpreting micro-expressions. Oliver Sacks, in his article in the New York Times, showed how people who cannot understand speech due to brain damage can still accurately assess truthfulness. He also suggests that this ability to interpret human behavior may be shared with animals such as a trained dog.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: Jinsi uwezo wa kupata maarifa na kujifunza ulivyobadilika kwa njia kama ilivyoelezewa hapo juu, ndivyo kiwango msingi ambacho kwacho maarifa yalipatikana kilivyobadilika. Njia ya kupata habari ilikuwa tofauti. Shaka haikuwa tena ndani ya kumbukumbu ya mtu binafsi, lakini uwezo wa kukumbuka maandishi ukawa wa kuzingatiwa zaidi. Kimsingi, Kipindi cha Mwamko kilifanya mabadiliko muhimu katika mbinu za kujifunza na usambazaji wa maarifa.
mt: As the ability to acquire and learn information has changed as described above, so has the way information was obtained. The need to remember was no longer in the individual's memory, but the ability to remember writing was taken more seriously. In general, the Information Age made significant changes in the methods of learning and the dissemination of information.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: "Mtandao unachanganya vitu vya mawasiliano ya kundi la watu na ya kati ya mtu na mtu. Tabia za kipekee za mtandao hupelekea vipimo zaidi kuhusu matumizi na mbinu za kuridhisha. Kwa mfano, ""kujifunza"" na ""ushirikiano"" kunapendekezwa kama vichochezi muhimu kwa matumizi ya mtandao (James na wengine, 1995). Kushiriki kwa kibinafsi na ""mahusiano endelezi"" pia yalitambuliwa na Eighmey na McCord (1998) kama vipengele vipya vya motisha walipichunguza mjibizo wa hadhira katika tovuti."
mt: "The network brings together communication of groups and of individuals. The distinctive characteristics of the network lead to greater emphasis on use and satisfaction. For example, "learning" and "collaboration" are suggested as important features of network use (James et al., 1995). Personal sharing and "sustained relationships" were also identified by Eighmey and McCord (1998) as new motivators when they examined the label of the audience in websites."
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: Staili ya Kigothi ilifikia kilele katika kipindi kati ya karne za 10-11 na karne ya 14. Hapo mwanzoni mavazi yaliathiriwa na tamaduni za Baizantini kutoka mashariki. Hata hivyo, kwa sababu ya njia hafifu za mawasiliano, mitindo ya magharibi ilibakia nyuma kwa miaka 25 hadi 30. Kuelekea mwishoni mwa Zama za Kati Uropa magharibi ilianza kuendeleza staili yao wenyewe. Mojawapo ya maendeleo makubwa zaidi ya wakati huo kama matokeo ya krusedi watu walianza kutumia vifungo kukazia nguo.
mt: 10th-11th century and 14th century styles reached their peak. In the beginning, clothing was influenced by Byzantine culture from the east. However, because of the slow spread of communication, Western styles remained behind for 25 to 30 years. Towards the end of the Middle Ages, Western Europe began to develop their own styles. One of the most important developments of the time was the use of buttons to fasten clothing.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Tunaweza kuanza kuishi kama marafiki wazuri wa mazingira, tunaweza kujiunga na harakati za mazingira, na hata pia tunaweza kuwa wanaharakati ili kupunguza dhiki ya baadaye kwa kiwango fulani. Hii ni sawa na matibabu ya dalili katika hali nyingi. Hata hivyo, ikiwa hatutaki tu suluhisho la muda mfupi, basi tunastahili kupata shina la matatizo, nasi tupate kuizima. Ni wazi kabisa kuwa ulimwengu umebadilika sana kwa sababu ya maendeleo ya kibinadamu katika sayansi na teknolojia, nayo matatizo yameongezeka kwa sababu ya watu kuwa wengi kupita kiasi na mitindo ya ubadhirifu ya maisha ya wanadamu.
mt: We can start living as good stewards of the environment, we can join environmental movements, and we can even be activists to reduce the impact of future harm to some extent. This is similar to symptom management in many conditions. However, if we just want a quick fix, then we deserve to suffer, we deserve to suffer. It is obvious that the world has changed a lot because of human progress in science and technology, and the problems have increased because of people being too many and the lifestyles of human beings.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: Usawasishaji wa mamlaka ulikuwa mfumo ambamo mataifa ya Ulaya yalitafuta kudumisha uhuru wa majimbo yote ya Ulaya. Dhana ilikuwa kwamba mataifa yote ya Ulaya lazima yangejaribu kuzuia taifa moja lisiwe lenye nguvu, na basi serikali za kitaifa mara nyingi zilibadili muungano wao ili kudumisha usawa. Vita vya Urithi wa Uhispania viliashiria vita vya kwanza ambavyo shida yake kuu ilikuwa usawa wa madaraka. Hii iliashiria mabadiliko muhimu, kwani mamlaka ya Uingereza hawangeweza tena kujifanya kuwa vita vya kidini. Hivyo, Vita hivyo vya Miaka Thelathini vingekuwa vita vya mwisho kuitwa vita vya kidini.
mt: The concept of the League was that all European states should seek to maintain the independence of all European states. The idea was that all European states should try to prevent one state from becoming too powerful, and so governments often discussed their alliance to maintain balance. The War of the Spanish Succession signalled the first war that the problem of balance was the main issue. This signalled important changes, because the British government could no longer pretend that the war was religious. Thus, the War of the Thirty Years would be the last war to be called a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: Katika kipindi hiki cha historia ya Ulaya, Kanisa Katoliki, ambalo lilikuwa tajiri na lenye nguvu, likawa chini ya uchunguzi. kwa zaidi ya miaka elfu moja dini ya Kikristo imefunga majimbo ya Uropa pamoja licha ya kuwa na lugha na mila tofauti. I Nguvu zake zilizoenea kote ziliathiri wote toka mfalme hadi mtu wa kawaida. Mojawapo ya kanuni kuu za Kikristo ni kwamba mali inafaa kutumika kupunguza mateso na umasikini na kwamba hazina za kifedha za kanisa ziko hapo hususan kwa sababu hiyo. Mamlaka kuu ya kanisa yalikuwa katika Roma kwa zaidi ya miaka elfu na uwepo huu wa mamlaka na pesa katika sehemu moja ulipelekea wengi kuuuliza kama itikadi hii ilikuwa ikitekelezwa.
mt: In this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which was rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For more than a thousand years, Christianity had bound Europe together despite differences in language and culture. Its influence had permeated all levels of society, from king to commoner. One of the key principles of Christianity is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty, and that the church's financial resources are especially important for this reason. The central authority of the church was in Rome for more than a thousand years, and the existence of this authority and wealth in one place led many to question whether this doctrine was being practiced.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: Mfalme Louis XVI, Malkia Marie Antoinette, watoto wao wawili wadogo (Marie Therese mwenye umri wa miaka 11 na Louis Charles mwenye umri wa miaka minne) na dada ya mfalme Bibi Elizabeth waliojawa na hofu, mnamo Oktoba 6 1789 walilazimishwa kurudi Paris kutoka Versailles na umati wa wanawake wa sokoni. Katika gari la kukokotwa, walisafiri kuelekea Paris wakiwa wamezungukwa na umati wa watu waliopiga nduru na kutoa vitisho kwa Mfalme na Malkia kwa sauti kubwa. Umati wa watu uliwalazimisha Mfalme Na Malkia kufungua madirisha ya gari lao. Kwa wakati mmoja memba wa umati alipunga kichwa cha mlinzi mmoja wa kifalme aliyeuawa katika Versailles mbele ya Malkia aliyejawa na hofu.
mt: 6 October 1789, King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette, their two young children (Marie Therese age 11 and Louis Charles age four) and their sister Princess Elizabeth, who was in fear, were forced to return to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled towards Paris surrounded by a mob of people shouting and throwing objects at the King and Queen. The mob forced the King and Queen to open the doors of their carriage. For a moment a member of the mob struck the head of one of the King's guards who was killed in front of the Queen who was in fear.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Baada tu ya kuzuka kwa uhasama, Uingereza ilianzisha kizuizi cha kinevi dhidi ya Ujerumani. Mkakati ulikuwa na ufanisi, kukatisha vifaa muhimu vya kijeshi na kiraia, ingawa kizuizi hiki kilikiuka sheria ya kimataifa ambayo inakubaliwa kwa jumla iliyoratibiwa na mikataba kadhaa ya kimataifa katika karne mbili zilizopita. Uingereza ilitega mabomu kwenye maji ya kimataifa ili kuzuia meli zozote kuingia sehemu nzima za bahari, hivyo kuweka hatari hata kwa meli zisizoegemea upande wowote. Kwa kuwa kulikuwa na mwitikio mdogo kwa mbinu hii, Ujerumani ilitarajia majibu kama hayo kwa vita vyake ambavyo havijazuiliwa vya chini ya bahari.
mt: After the outbreak of war, the United Kingdom imposed a naval blockade on Germany. The blockade was successful in cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although it violated international law, which was established by several international treaties in the previous two centuries. The United Kingdom dropped bombs into international waters to prevent any ship from entering the entire sea area, thus endangering any ship regardless of its side. Because there was little resistance to this method, Germany expected similar responses to its own war, which was not declared under the sea.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: Katika Amerika yote, kuna takribani kesi 400,000 zinazojulikana za Sklerosisi ya Sehemu Nyingi (MS), na kuuwacha kuwa ugonjwa wa neva unaoongoza katika vijana na watu wazima wenye umri wa kati. Selerosisiwingi ni ugonjwa unaoathiri mfumo mkuu wa neva, ambao unajumuisha ubongo, uti wa mgongo na neva ya macho. Utafiti umebainisha kuwa wanawake wana uwezekano maradufu wa kuugua selerosisiwingi kuliko wanaume.
mt: 400,000 cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS) are known in the United States, and the disease is the leading cause of neurological disability in young and middle-aged adults. MS affects the central nervous system, which includes the brain, spinal cord and optic nerves. Research has shown that women are more likely to develop MS than men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: Utafiti ulionyesha kwamba mafadhaiko, uoga na kutia janga chumvi kulipatanisha uhusiano kati ya uchungu na ulemavu kwa walio na maumivu ya sehemu ya chini ya mgongo. Ni athari tu za kutia janga chumvi, si mafadhaiko na uoga, zilizokuwa na masharti ya vipindi vya PA vya mara kwa mara kila wiki. Walioshiriki katika shughuli za mara kwa mara walihitaji usaidizi zaidi kubainisha tofauti za uchungu sugu na hisia za usumbufu kutokana na msogeo wa kawaida wa kimwili, kuhusiana na mtazamo hasi wa uchungu.
mt: A study showed that depression, anxiety and stress were associated with low back pain. It was only the stress, not depression and anxiety, that had time-limited, weekly fluctuations. Participants in the weekly study needed more help to distinguish between mild and moderate depression and stress, in relation to the usual physical symptoms, in terms of a negative view of depression.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: Mchezo wa kisasa wa kupigana kwa sime huchezwa kwa viwango vingi, toka wanafunzi wanaosoma katika chuo kikuu hadi mashindano ya kitaalamu na Olimpiki. Mchezo huo huchezwa kimsingi kwa muundo wa kupigana, mchezaji mmoja akipigana na mwingine.
mt: 21st century combat sports are played at many levels, from university students to professional and Olympic competitions. The sport is played primarily by two players, one against the other.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: Sumu ya ndani inaweza kukosa kuwa dhahiri papo hapo. Dalili, kama vile kutapika ni jumla kiasi kwamba utambuzi wa mara moja hauwezi kufanywa. Dalili bora ya sumu ya ndani inaweza kuwa kuwepo kwa chombo wazi cha dawa ama kemikali za kaya zenye sumu. Angalia lebo kwa maagizo maalum ya huduma ya kwanza ya sumu hiyo.
mt: Internal bleeding can be hard to detect. Symptoms, such as nausea, are a whole and diagnosis can't be made. The best sign of internal bleeding can be the presence of an open wound or chemicals with poison. See the box for specific first aid instructions for this injury.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Ili Kumwangalia mwathirika, ni lazima kwanza uchunguze eneo ili kuhakikisha usalama wako. Unahitaji kugundua nafasi ya mwathiriwa unapoenda kumkaribia na kiashiria vyovyote vya kawaida vya hatari. Ikiwa utaumia ukijaribu kusaidia, huenda utafanya mambo kuwa mabaya zaidi tu.
mt: To assess the situation, you must first evaluate the area to ensure your safety. You need to determine the location of the victim and any signs of danger. If you attempt to help, you may make things worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: Kuna athari nyingi za kijamii na kisiasa kama vile utumiaji wa mfumo wa metriki, mabadiliko kutoka kwa msimamo wa udikteta hadi ujamhuri, utaifa na imani kuwa inchi ni ya watu si ya mtawala mmoja pekee. Pia baada ya Mapinduzi kazi ilikuwa wazi kwa waombaji wote wa kiume, hivyo kuruhusu waliojitakia makuu na wenye mafanikio kufaulu. Vilevile kwa wanajeshi kwa sababu badala ya madaraka ya kijeshi kutegemea darasa sasa yanategemea sifa. Mapinduzi ya Kifaransa pia yalichochea wafanyakazi wengine wengi wa nchi nyingine waliokandamizwa kuanza mapinduzi yao wenyewe.
mt: There were many social and political consequences, such as the adoption of the metric system, the shift from dictatorship to republic, nationalism and the belief that the country belonged to the people, not to one man. Also, after the Revolution, the military was open to all male applicants, allowing the best and most successful to succeed. Also, for soldiers, instead of relying on military schools, they now relied on merit. The French Revolution also inspired many workers in other countries to start their own revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Kila mtu hushiriki katika jamii na kutumia mifumo ya uchukuzi. Karibu kila mtu hulalamika kuhusu mifumo ya uchukuzi. Katika nchi zilizostawi ni nadra kusikia viwango sawa vya malalamiko kuhusu ubora wa maji au uporomokaji wa madaraja. Ni kwa nini mifumo ya usafiri huweka hisia kwenye malalamiko kama hayo, kwa nini wao hufeli kila siku? Ni kwamba wahandisi wa usafiri hawajiwezi? Au kuna kitu cha msingi zaidi kinachoendelea?
mt: Everyone participates in a community and uses routing protocols. Everyone complains about routing protocols. In developed countries it is rare to hear complaints about the quality of water or the flooding of roads. Why do routing protocols put feelings in these complaints, why do they fail every day? Are routing experts incompetent? Or is there something more fundamental going on?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: Mtiririko wa Trafiki ni utafiti wa mwondoko wa madereva binafsi na magari kati ya sehemu mbili na mwingiliano wanaofanya na wenzao. Kwa bahati mbaya, kutafiti mtiririko wa trafiki ni vigumu kwa sababu tabia ya dereva haiwezi kutabiriwa kwa uhakika wa asilimia mia moja. Kwa bahati, madereva huwa na mazoea kwa upatano fulani; kwa hivyo, misongamano ya trafiki huwa na uthabiti fulani na inaweza kuwakilishwa haswa kitakwimu. Ili kuwakilisha mtiririko wa trafiki vizuri, uhusiano umeanzishwa kati ya hali tatu kuu: (1) mtiririko, (2) uzito, (3) kasimwelekeo. Mahusiano haya husaidia katika upangaji, kubuni, na uendeshaji wa welekevu barabarani.
mt: Traffic flow is a time-dependent interaction between individual drivers and vehicles between two points and their interactions with other drivers and vehicles. Unfortunately, predicting traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior is unpredictable with certainty. However, drivers tend to have certain propensities; therefore, traffic flow tends to have certain propensities and can be represented statistically. To represent traffic flow well, three main relationships have been established: (1) traffic flow, (2) density, (3) speed. These relationships help in modeling, designing, and controlling traffic flow.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: Jaribio la Hershey na Chase lilikuwa mojawapo ya mapendekezo kwamba DNA ilikuwa nyenzo za nasaba. Hershey na Chase walitumia virusi kuchomeka DNA yao wenyewe ndani ya bakteria. Walifanya majaribio mawili kuashiria DNA kwenye virusi kwa fosforasi nururifuau protini ya virusi kwa salfa nururishi.
mt: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the proposals that DNA was the hereditary material. Hershey and Chase used viruses to incorporate their own DNA into bacteria. They performed two experiments to indicate DNA in viruses by radioactive phosphorus and viral protein by radioactive sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Mabadiliko yanaweza kuwa na athari tofauti kutegemea aina ya mabadiliko, umuhimu wa kifaa cha maumbile kilichoathiriwa na ikiwa seli zilizoathiriwa ni seli za vijidudu. Ni mabadiliko ya seli za vijidudu tu ambayo yanaweza kusambazwa kwa watoto, huku mabadiliko kwingineko yakiweza kusababisha seli za kifo au saratani.
mt: The effects of the changes can vary depending on the type of affected equipment, the importance of the affected device, and whether the affected cells are stem cells. Only stem cell changes can be transmitted to children, while other changes can cause death or cancer cells.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Yaelekea mbuzi walianza kufugwa takriban miaka 10,000 iliyopita katika Milima ya Zagrosi ya Irani. Tamaduni na makabila ya kale yalianza kuwafuga kwa ufikiaji rahisi wa maziwa, nywele, nyama, na ngozi. Kijumla, mbuzi wa nyumbani walianza kufugwa kwa makundi yaliyotangatanga milimani au maeneo mengine ya malisho, huku yakisimamiwa na walinzi ambao mara nyingi walikuwa watoto au vijana wachanga, sawia na wachungaji wanaofahamika sana. Mbinu hizi za ufugaji bado zinatumika hata leo.
mt: It is believed that sheep were first domesticated approximately 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran.  Early cultures and peoples began to domesticate sheep for their milk, wool, meat, and skin.  In general, sheep were domesticated in herds or flocks, with the herds or flocks being tended by shepherds, who were often children or young adults, or by shepherds who were well known and respected.  These methods of sheep husbandry are still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: Gofu ni mchezo ambao wachezaji hutumia rungu kuingiza mipira mashimoni. Mashimo kumi na manane huchezwa wakati wa duru ya kawaida, na wachezaji kawaida huanzia shimo la kwanza kwenye uwanja na kumalizia kwenye shimo la kumi na nane. Mchezaji ambaye hufanya mipigo michache zaidi, au mizunguko ya rungu, kukamilisha mkondo hushinda. Mchezo huo huchezwa kwenye nyasi, na nyasi zilizo karibu na shimo hukatwa ziwe fupi na huitwa kijani kibichi.
mt: 9-pin bowling is a game in which players use a ball to knock down pins. Ten pins are set up at the beginning of a regular game, and players begin and end on the first and eighth pins, respectively. The player who knocks down the most pins, or throws the fewest balls, wins. The game is played on grass, and grass near the pins is cut short and dyed green.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: Gofu ni mchezo ambao wachezaji hutumia rungu kuingiza mipira mashimoni. Mashimo kumi na manane huchezwa wakati wa duru ya kawaida, na wachezaji kawaida huanzia shimo la kwanza kwenye uwanja na kumalizia kwenye shimo la kumi na nane. Mchezaji ambaye hufanya mipigo michache zaidi, au mizunguko ya rungu, kukamilisha mkondo hushinda. Mchezo huo huchezwa kwenye nyasi, na nyasi zilizo karibu na shimo hukatwa ziwe fupi na huitwa kijani kibichi.
mt: 9-pin bowling is a game in which players use a ball to knock down pins. Ten pins are set up at the beginning of a regular game, and players begin and end on the first and eighth pins, respectively. The player who knocks down the most pins, or throws the fewest balls, wins. The game is played on grass, and grass near the pins is cut short and dyed green.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: Lengo kuu la Sayansi ni kubaini njia ambayo ulimwengu utaendeshwa kwa mbinu za kisayansi. Kwa kweli, mbinu hii huongoza tafiti nyingi za kisayansi. Haiko peke yake hata hivyo, majaribio, na jaribio ni upimaji ambao hutumiwa kuondoa nadharia moja au mbili zinazowezekana, kuuliza maswali, na kufanya uchunguzi pia huongoza utafiti wa kisayansi.
mt: The goal of science is to find ways that the universe can be explained by scientific means. Indeed, this method leads to many scientific investigations. It is not alone, however, experiments, and experiments are measurements that are used to eliminate one or two hypotheses that are possible, to ask questions, and to conduct scientific investigations.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Vimbunga hupiga sehemu ndogo ikilinganishwa na dhoruba zingine kali, lakini vinaweza kuharibu kila kitu kilichopo njiani mwao. Tufani hung’oa miti, kupasua mbao kutoka kwa majengo, na kurusha magari juu angani. Asilimia mbili ya tufani zenye vurugu zaidi hudumu kwa zaidi ya saa tatu. Dhoruba hizi za ajabu zina upepo wa hadi kilomita 480 kwa saa (mita 133 kwa sekunde; maili 300 kwa saa).
mt: Hurricanes are smaller than other tropical storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. They tear down trees, strip buildings of their roofs, and toss cars into the air. The most violent hurricanes last for more than two hours. These storms can reach speeds of 480 kilometers per hour (133 meters per second; 300 miles per hour).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Binadamu wamekuwa wakitengeneza na kutumia lenzi za kukuza kwa maelfu na maelfu ya miaka. Hata hivyo, darubini halisi za kwanza zilitengenezewa Uropa katika karne ya 16. Darubini hizi zilitumia mchanganyiko wa lenzi mbili kufanya vitu vilivyo mbali kuonekana kuwakaribu na kubwa.
mt: Humans have been using and breeding chickens for thousands of years. However, the first true breeds were developed in Europe in the 16th century. These breeds used a combination of two breeds to make things look similar to and larger than the original breeds.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: "Muhammad alivutiwa sana na mambo zaidi ya maisha haya ya kawaida. Alikuwa akitembelea sana pango ambalo lilikuja kujulikana kama ""Hira"" katika mlima wa ""Noor"" (nuru) kwa kutafakari. Pango lenyewe, ambalo lilinusurika nyakati, hutoa picha dhahiri ya mielekeo ya kiroho ya Muhammad. Likiwa juu ya mojawapo ya milima kaskazini mwa Mecca, pango hilo limetengwa kabisa na ulimwengu. Kwa kweli, si rahisi kupata kamwe hata kama mtu alijua ipo. Ukishaingia kwenye pango, umetengwa kabisa. Hakuna kingine kinachoweza kuonekana ila anga safi na nzuri huko juu na milima mingi inayolizunguka. Ni machache sana ya dunia hii yanayoweza kuonwa au kusikiwa ndani ya pango hili."
mt: "Muhammad was drawn to things more than ordinary life. He used to visit the cave that came to be known as the "Hira" in the mountain of "Noor" (nuru) to think. The cave itself, which is secluded, gives a clear picture of Muhammad's spiritual direction. Located on one of the mountains in the north of Mecca, the cave has been completely removed from the world. In fact, it is very difficult to find even if someone knew it was there. Once you enter the cave, you are completely removed. Nothing else can be seen except the clear and beautiful sky above and the many mountains surrounding it. It is one of the few things in this world that can be seen or heard within this cave."
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: Magari yanayosukokotwana farasi yalijengwa huko Uingereza mapema kama karne ya 16. Ingawa njia za magari zilisheheni magogo sambamba ya miti, zilihuruhusu farasi kuzivuta kwa kasi zaidi na kuvuta mizigo mikubwa kiasi kwa barabara mbaya za siku. Nguzomlalo zilianzishwa mapema kiasi ili kushikilia reli mahali pake. Hata hivyo, kadiri muda ulivyoendelea iligunduliwa kwamba reli hizo zingefanya kazi bora zaidi ikiwa kipande cha chuma kingewekelewa juu. Hii ilikuja kuwa desturi, lakini chuma kilisababisha kuharibika kwa magurudumu ya mbao ya magari ya kukokotwa. Hatimaye, magurudumu ya mbao yalibadilishwa na magurudumu ya vyuma. Mnamo 1767, reli za kwanza za vyuma kamili zilianzishwa.
mt: Horses were first used for road transport in 4500 BC. The use of horses in transport fell off in Europe with the Industrial Revolution, the coming of the automobile, and the development of public transport. The horse-manufacturing industry, which has made a significant contribution to the economy of many countries, is important for small farming communities, which use it to pull sleds and carriages. It is also used for transporting light goods and people in both rural and urban areas.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
