src: Uroma ulikuwa na kipengele kikubwa cha maamuzi ya kitamaduni yaliyochochewa na waandishi kama vile Goethe, Fichte na Schlegel. Katika muktadha wa Uroma, jiografia ilifinyanga watu, na kwa mpito wa wakati mila na tamaduni zilizohusiana na jiografia zilizuka, na hizi, zikiwa zinapatana na hali ya jamii, zilikuwa bora kuliko sheria zilizolazimishwa kiholela.
mt: 19th-century German Romanticism was a major cultural movement that emphasized the importance of nature, spirituality, and emotion. In the context of Romanticism, geography shaped people, and as time passed, customs and cultures associated with geography emerged, and these, in turn, were better than imposed laws.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: "Uainishaji wa kiufundi ni kishazi ambacho hujumuisha maoni anuai katika mazoezi, kutoka teknolojia shinikizi, au maendeleo ya kiteknolojia katika dhana kuwa hatma ya binadamu huendeshwa na mantiki ya msingi inayohusishwa na sheria za kisayansi na udhihirisho wake katika teknolojia. Tafsiri nyingi za udhibitisho wa kiteknolojia zinashirikisha maoni mawili ya jumla: kwamba maendeleo ya teknolojia yenyewe hufuata njia zaidi ya ushawishi wa kitamaduni au kisiasa, na teknolojia hiyo kwa upande ina ""athari"" kwa jamii ambazo ni za asili, badala ya hali ya kijamii. Kwa mfano, mtu anaweza kusema kwamba motokaa hupelekea ukuzaji wa barabara. Hata hivyo, mfumo wa kitaifa wa barabara hufai kiuchumi kwa magari machache tu, kwa hivyo mbinu mpya za uzalishaji zinakuzwa ili kupunguza gharama ya umiliki wa magari. Umiliki wa magari kwa wingi pia hupelekea matukio mengi ya ajali za barabarani, ambazo hupelekea uvumbuzi wa mbinu mpya katika matibabu za kutengeneza miili iliyovunjika."
mt: "The technological determinist view is a reductionist view that incorporates the results of experiments, from technological innovation, or technological progress in the belief that the ultimate goal of humanity is driven by fundamental scientific principles and their demonstration in technology. Many interpretations of technological determinism involve two general claims: that technological development itself follows cultural or political influences, and that technology itself has ""effects"" on societies that are ""primordial,"" rather than social. For example, one might say that cars cause road congestion. However, the national system of roads is economically efficient only for a small number of cars, so new production methods are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Car ownership also causes many road accidents, which leads to the development of new medical techniques for repairing damaged bodies.
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: "Alama ya ""gubeti la juu"" inaonekana kama V na ""alama ya gubeti la chini"" kama kibanio au mraba unaokosa upande wake wa chini. Juu inamaanisha unapaswa kuanzia nchani na kusukuma uta, na chini inamaanisha unafaa kuanzia kwenye frog (mahali ambapo mkono wako unashikilia uta) na kuvuta uta. Upinde wa juu kwa kawaida huzalisha sauti tulivu, huku upinde wa chini ukiwa na nguvu na ni imara zaidi. Jisikie huru kuandika kwa penseli alama zako, lakini kumbuka alama za kuinama zilizochapwa ziko kwa sababu ya kimziki, kwa hivyo yafaa ziheshimiwe."
mt: "The "up" arrow looks like a V and the "down" arrow looks like a box or square missing its bottom. Up means you should start from the inside and push the pen, and down means you should start from the frog (where your hand is holding the pen) and pull the pen. The up stroke usually produces a soft sound, while the down stroke is stronger and more durable. Think carefully about how you write your letters, but remember that printed letters are designed for right-handed people, so they should be reversed."
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: Tofauti na nyani wengine, hominidi hawatumii mikono yao kwa kutembea, kubebea uzito au kubembea kwenye miti. Mkono na mguu wa sokwe ni sawa kwa ukubwa na urefu, kuonyesha matumizi ya mkono kwa kubeba uzito katika kutembea kwa konzi. Mkono wa binadamu ni mfupi kuliko mguu, na una mifupa minyoofu zaidi.. Visukuku vya mifupa ya mikono vilivyo na miaka milioni mbili hadi milioni tatu vinafunua haya mabadiliko ya utaalam wa mkono kutoka kwa kuusongesha na kuutumia.
mt: Unlike other apes, hominids do not use their hands for walking, carrying weight or climbing trees. The hand of a human is shorter than the arm, and has fewer knuckle joints.. Fossilized hand bones dating back two to three million years reveal these changes in hand dexterity from grasping and using.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

src: Utafiti wa karne ya ishirini umeonyesha kwamba kuna makundi mawili ya utofauti wa jeni: fiche na zilizoelezewa. Mabadiliko huongeza tofauti za kimaumbile, na uchaguzi huyaondoa katika mkusanyiko wa tofauti zilizoonyeshwa. Mabadiliko ya uchangaji ya utengaji na uchanganyaji tena huku na huko kati ya vidimbwi hivyo viwili kwa kila kizazi.
mt: 20th century research has shown that there are two distinct types of genes: dominant and recessive. Mutations increase the physical differences, and selection of the two types of alleles for each generation.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: Nje kwenye savana, ni vigumu kwa wanyama wakuu waliyo na mfumo wa kuyeyusha chakula tumboni kama wa binadamu kutoshelezeza mahitaji ya tindikali-za-amino zao kutoka kwa vifaa vya mimea vilivyomo Waaidha, kukosa kufanya hivyo kuna matokeo mazito: udidimiaji wa ukuaji, utapiamlo, na hatimaye kifo. Rasilimali za mimea zinazofikiwa kwa urahisi zingekuwa protini zinazopatikana katika majani na kunde, lakini hizi ni ngumu kwa wale wa kundi la mammalia wa hali ya juu kama sisi kusaga isipokuwa kama zimepikwa. Kwa kulinganisha, vyakula vya wanyama (siafu, mchwa, mayai) si kwamba vinameng’enywa kwa urahisi tu, lakini pia hutoa protini zenye kiwango kikubwa ambazo zina asidi muhimu za amino. Mambo yote yakizingatiwa, hatupaswi kushangaa kama wahenga wetu walitatua “shida yao ya protini” kwa njia sawa na zile nyani wa savanna hufanya leo.
mt: In the savanna, it is difficult for large animals with a digestive system like ours to extract the amino acid requirements from the plant materials available. The consequences of not doing so are severe: stunted growth, malnutrition, and death. Nutrients that are easily available in plants and grasses are proteins that are found in leaves and stems, but these are difficult for the higher mammals of the savanna to digest, except when they are processed. Even though the foods of animals (ants, termites, eggs) are not easily digested, they also provide high levels of protein with important amino acids. All things considered, it is not surprising that our ancestors found a “protein solution” similar to what the savanna animals do today.
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

The consequences of not doing so are severe: stunted growth, malnutrition, and death. Nutrients that are easily available in plants and grasses are proteins that are found in leaves and stems, but these are difficult for the higher mammals of the savanna to digest, except when they are processed. Even though the foods of animals (ants, termites, eggs) are not easily digested, they also provide high levels of protein with important amino acids. All things considered, it is not surprising that our ancestors found a “protein solution” similar to what the savanna animals do today.
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: Utamaduni mdogo huwaleta pamoja watu walio wa mafikira sawa na ambao wanahisi kuwa wametengwa na viwango vya kijamii na kuwaruhusu kuendeleza hisia za utambulisho. Vikundi vidogo vya tamaduni vinaweza kuwa vya kipekee kwa sababu ya umri, kabila, daraja, eneo, na/au jinsia ya washiriki. Sifa zinazofanya utamaduni mdogo kuwa wa kipekee huenda zikawa za kilugha, kiurembo, kidini, kisiasa, kijiografia au mchanganyiko wa vipengele. Wanachama wa utamaduni mdogo mdogo kwa mara nyingi huashiria uanachama wao kupitia mitindo ya kipekee ambayo ni pamoja na mitindo ya kimavazi, tabia na lugha.
mt: A small culture brings together people who are similar in age, ethnicity, class, region, and/or gender. Characteristics that make a small culture unique may include physical, intellectual, religious, political, geographic, or a combination of traits. Members of a small culture often identify their membership through unique practices, including dress, behavior, and language.
ref: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.

src: Watoto hukuza ufahamu wa utaifa na kasumba za utaifa wakiwa wangali wachanga na kasumba hizo za utaifa huathiri tabia. Kwa mfano, watoto ambao wanashirikishwa na uchache wa kabila wanaodhaniwa kuwa hawafanyi vizuri shuleni huwa hawafanyi vizuri shuleni mara tu wanapogundua juu ya dhana linalohusishwa na kabila zao.
mt: Children who are exposed to stereotypes and stereotypes of children who are believed to be doing poorly in school are doing poorly in school as soon as they realize the stereotype associated with their ethnicity.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: "Mojawapo ya mbinu maarufu zinatozumiwa kuonyesha umuhimu wa kushirikiana ni kutumia mifano michache sikitishi ya watoto ambao, kupitia mapuuza, mikosi, kunyanyaswa kimakusudi, hawakushirikishwa na watu wazima walipokuwa wanapokua. Watoto kama hao huitwa ""katili"" au jeuri. Watoto wengine katili wamefungwa na watu (kwa kawaida wazazi wao wenyewe); katika hali nyingine huu kuachwa kwa watoto kulitokana na wazazi kukataa upungufu mkubwa wa kiakili au mwili kwa mtoto. Huenda watoto wasiotagusana walipitia unyanyasaji mkuu au kiwewe utotoni mwao kabla ya kuachiliwa au kutoroka. Wengine wanadaiwa kulewa na wanyama; wengine wanasemekana kuishi porini kivyao. Anapolelewa kabisa na wanyama wasio wa kibinadamu, mtoto katili huonyesha tabia (ndani ya mipaka ya kimwili) karibu kabisa kama zile za mnyama mahsusi wa utunzaji, kama vile hofu au upurukushani wake kwa wanadamu."
mt: "One of the most commonly used examples of the importance of cooperation is the use of orphaned children, through foster homes, orphanages, and deliberate neglect, who are called "feral" or "feral children." Feral children have been isolated from human contact (usually their parents) and raised by animals. They are said to exhibit behavior (within the limits of their physical capabilities) very similar to that of the specialized animal caretakers, such as fear or aggression towards humans.
ref: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."

src: Kilimo cha kujikimu ni kilimo ambacho hufanywa kwa uzalishaji wa chakula cha kutosha tu kukimu mahitaji ya mkulima na familia yake. Kilimo cha kujikimu ni mfumo rahisi, aghalabu wa kikaboni, unaotumia mbegu zilizohifadhiwa na asilia kwa eneo husika, pamoja na mzunguko wa mimea au mbinu mbadala zilizo rahisi ili kuboresha mavuno. Kihistoria, wakulima wengi walijihusisha na kilimo cha kujikimu na hii bado ndiyo hali katika mataifa mengi yanayoendelea.
mt: Subsistence farming is farming of sufficient food production only to feed the farmer and his family. Subsistence farming is a simple, low-input, system, using stored native seeds from the local area, along with crop rotation or other easy methods to improve yields. Historically, many farmers have been involved in subsistence farming and this is still the case in many developing countries.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: Pengine aina ya kawaida zaidi ya utalii ni ambayo watu wengi huhusisha na usafiri: Utalii wa burudani. Huu ni wakati watu wanaenda mahali ambapo ni tofauti sana na maisha yao ya kawaida ya kila siku kupumzika na kufurahia. Pwani, bustani maalum na nyanja za kambi mara nyingi huwa sehemu ambazo hutembelewa sana na watalii wa kujiburudisha. Kama lengo la mwafulani la kutembelea mahali maalum ni kujua historia na utamaduni wake basi aina hii ya utalii inajulikana kama utalii wa kitamaduni. Watalii wanaweza kutembelea alama tofauti za ardhi za nchi maalum au wanaweza tu kuchagua kuangazia eneo moja tu.
mt: Tourism is often associated with leisure: people go to places that are different from their everyday lives to relax and enjoy themselves. Beaches, botanical gardens and campgrounds are often popular destinations for leisure tourists. If the purpose of a particular visit is to learn about history and culture, this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists can visit the unique landmarks of a particular country or they can just choose to focus on one area.
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

src: Watu waliohusika kwa miongo kadhaa walitusaidia kuthamini uwezo na shauku zetu huku tukitathmini shida na hata kutofaulu kwa uwazi. Wakati wa kusikiliza watu wakishirikisha hadithi za kibinafsi, kifamilia au kishirika, tulipata ufahamu wa kale wenye thamani na baadhi ya watu ambao waliathiri utamaduni wa shirika kwa njia nzuri au mbaya. Wakati kuelewa historia ya mtu hakumaanishi kuelewa utamaduni, angalau huwasaidia watu kupata hisia za mahali waliko katika historia ya shirika. Wakati wa kutathmini mafanikio na kufahamu kutofaulu, watu binafsi na watu wote wanaoshiriki hugundua kwa kina zaidi maadili, misheni na nguvu za uendeshaji za shirika. Kwa wakati huu, kukumbuka matukio ya awali ya tabia za ujasiriamali na mafanikio yaliyofuatia kulisaidia watu kuwa wazi kwa mabadiliko mapya na mwelekeo mpya wa kanisa la kienyeji. Hadithi kama hizi za mafanikio zilipunguza hofu ya mabadiliko, huku zikiunda mielekeo chanya kuhusu mabadiliko wakati ujao.
mt: We were able to help people understand their place in the organization's history by sharing personal, family, or group stories. When listening to people share stories, we gained insight into the organization's culture, both good and bad. When assessing successes and understanding failures, individuals and all participants gained a deeper understanding of the organization's values, mission, and leadership. At this point, recalling past instances of entrepreneurial behavior and subsequent successes helped people be open to new changes and new directions for the local church. These stories of success reduced fears of change, while also creating a sense of anticipation for future changes.
ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.

src: Njia ya usasa ya kujifunza hutoa uhuru kutoka kwa kanuni mahsusi. Hakuna njia moja nzuri ya kujifunza. Kwa kweli, hakuna jambo hata moja zuri la kujifunza. Kujifunza hufanyika katika uzoefu kati ya mwanafunzi na maarifa yanayowasilishwa. Uzoefu wetu wa sasa wa fanya-mwenyewe na uwasilishaji wa taarifa, vipindi vya televisheni vyenye msingi wa kujifunza, vinaonyesha pointi hii. Kwa hivyo wengi wetu hujipata tukitazama kipindi cha runinga ambacho hutujulisha kuhusu mchakato au uzoefu ambao hatutawahi kushiriki au kutumia maarifa hayo. Hatutawahi kukarabati gari lote, kujenga chemchemi katika ua letu la nyuma, kusafiri Peru kukagua magofu ya kale, au kubuni upya nyumba ya jirani.
mt: The self-directed learning process is free from special rules. There is no one right way to learn. In fact, there is no one right thing to learn. Learning happens in the interaction between learner and knowledge. Our current experience of self-directed learning and knowledge dissemination, including educational television programs, shows this point. So many of us get exposed to a program that tells us about a process or experience that we will never participate in or use that knowledge. We will never rebuild all the cars, build a dam in our backyard, travel to Peru to see ancient ruins, or invent a new neighbor's house.
ref: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.

src: Ukatizaji wa usingizi ni mchakato wa kuamka kimakusudi wakati wa usingizi wako wa kawaida na kupatwa na usingizi muda mfupi baadaye (dakika 10-60). Hili linaweza kufanywa kwa kutumia saa ya kengele isiyo na kelele kubwa sana ili kukufanya upate fahamu bila kukuamsha kabisa. Kama utajipata ukiweka upya saa ya kengele katika usingizi wako, inaweza kuwekwa upande mwingine wa chumba, ili kukulazimu kuondoka kitandani kuizima. Chaguo zingine za midundobayolojia huhusisha unywaji mwingi (hususan wa maji au chai, dawa maarufu) kabla ya kulala, hali inayomlazimu mtu kuamka ili kwenda haja ndogo.
mt: Wakefulness maintenance is a deliberate waking during your normal sleep period and being woken by a short (10-60 minute) nap later. This can be done by using a quiet alarm clock to gently wake you without fully waking you. If you can put the alarm clock in a different part of the room, it will force you to get up to turn it off. Other sleep hygiene choices include drinking a lot (especially water or tea, a popular choice) before going to bed, a condition that requires you to wake up to go to the bathroom.
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: Watu wengine wanaamini kuwa kupata ndoto nyingi bandia mara nyingi kunaweza kuchosha sana. Sababu kuu ya jambo hili ni matokeo ya ndoto dhahiri kupanua kipindi cha wakati kati ya majimbo ya REM. Ikiwa na vipindi vifupi vya usogezaji macho kwa haraka, hali hii ambapo unapata usingizi halisi na mwili wako kupata nafuu huwa nadra kiasi cha kuwa tatizo. Hii inachosha sawa na ungekuwa unaamka baada ya kila dakika ishirini au thelathini na kutazama runinga. Athari inategemea ni mara ngapi ubongo wako hujaribu kupata ndoto dhahiri.
mt: Some people believe that having many vivid dreams can be very tiring. The main reason for this is the REM sleep periods becoming shorter. If you have short periods of actual sleep and your body is not getting enough rest, this is similar to waking up every twenty or thirty minutes and watching television. The effect depends on how many times your brain tries to have a vivid dream.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

src: Watu wengine wanaamini kuwa kupata ndoto nyingi bandia mara nyingi kunaweza kuchosha sana. Sababu kuu ya jambo hili ni matokeo ya ndoto dhahiri kupanua kipindi cha wakati kati ya majimbo ya REM. Ikiwa na vipindi vifupi vya usogezaji macho kwa haraka, hali hii ambapo unapata usingizi halisi na mwili wako kupata nafuu huwa nadra kiasi cha kuwa tatizo. Hii inachosha sawa na ungekuwa unaamka baada ya kila dakika ishirini au thelathini na kutazama runinga. Athari inategemea ni mara ngapi ubongo wako hujaribu kupata ndoto dhahiri.
mt: Some people believe that having many vivid dreams can be very tiring. The main reason for this is the REM sleep periods becoming shorter. If you have short periods of actual sleep and your body is not getting enough rest, this is similar to waking up every twenty or thirty minutes and watching television. The effect depends on how many times your brain tries to have a vivid dream.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

src: Timu za kawaida zinashikiliwa kwa viwango sawa vya ubora kama timu za kawaida lakini kuna tofauti hila. Memba pepe wa timu mara nyingi hutumika kama mahali pa mawasiliano kwa kikundi chao cha kimwili cha wakati huo. Mara nyingi wao huwa na uhuru zaidi kuliko wanachama wa kawaida wa timu kwani timu zao zinaweza kukutana kulingana na maeneo ya wakati yanayotofautiana na inaweza kutoeleweka kwa usimamizi wao. Uwepo wa “timu isiyoonekana” ya kweli (Larson na LaFasto, 1989, uk109) ni kipengele cha kipekee cha timu pepe. “Timu isiyoonekana” ni timu ya usimamizi ambapo kila memba huripoti. Timu isiyoonekana huweka viwango kwa kila memba.
mt: 1. Standard teams are of equal quality to standard teams but there are some differences. The team’s “peers” are often used as a place for physical communication for their group at the time. Often they have more freedom than standard team members because their teams can meet according to time zones and can be difficult to manage. The actual “invisible” team (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p.109) is a special feature of peer teams. The “invisible” team is a management team where each member reports. Invisible teams set standards for each member.
ref: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.

src: Nadharia za maudhui hulenga kupata kinachowafanya watu waendelee au kinachowavutia. Nadharia hizi zinapendekeza kwamba watu wana mahitaji fulani na/au tamaa ambazo zimekita mizizi jinsi wanavyokomaa katika utu uzima. Nadharia hizi huangalia ni nini kinachowahusu watu fulani ambacho huwafanya watake vitu wanavyofanya na ni mambo gani katika mazingira yao yanayowafanya kufanya au kutofanya mambo fulani. Nadharia mbili maarufu za maudhui ni Udadisi wa Maslow wa Mahitaji na Nadharia ya Vipengele Viwili ya Hertzberg.
mt: Content theories attempt to explain what motivates people to continue or to change. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires that have taken root in the way they perceive themselves. These theories examine what motivates people to do or not do certain things. Two well-known content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs and Hertzberg's Two-Factor Theory.
ref: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood. These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

src: Sheria ya thuluthi inayotumiwa vibaya na kudhihakiwa mara nyingi ni mwongozo rahisi unaounda uwezo huku ukidumisha kiwango cha mpango katika picha. Inasema kwamba mahali palipo na athari kubwa kwa mada kuu ni katika mkutano wa mistari inayogawanya picha kwa thuluthi wima na mshazari (tazama mfano).
mt: A common mistake and often overused rule is a simple guideline that establishes a capability while maintaining a level of detail in a picture. It says that where the main subject is most affected by the main point is in the meeting of lines that divide the picture into thirds and a horizon (see example).
ref: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).

src: Kwa mfano, umbizo la upigaji picha tuli wa kawaida zaidi duniani ni milimita 35, ambayo ndiyo iliyokuwa saizi kuu ya filamu katika zama za sinema za kikale. Bado inatolewa hadi wa leo, lakini kwa umuhimu zaidi uwiano wa kipengele chake umerithiwa na umbizo za kihisio cha picha za kamera za kidijitali. Muundo wa 35mm kwa kweli, kwa kiasi Fulani unachanganya, 36mm kwa upana na 24mm kwa urefu. Uwiano-vipimo wa muundo huu (kugawa na kumi na mbili ili kupata uwiano rahisi zaidi wa namba kamili) basi husemekana kuwa 3:2. Miundo mingi ya kawaida (familia ya APS ya miundoi, kwa mfano) ni sawa na au takribani sawa na uwiano huu.
mt: 35mm is the most common film stock in the world, and was the standard size for movies in the silent era. It is still used, but more importantly, the aspect ratio of this format (divide by two to get a more familiar whole number) is 3:2. Many common formats (such as the APS family of films) are either equal to or close to this.
ref: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.

src: Ubaya wa lenzi za kupanua au kupunguza mwonekano ni kwamba utata wa kiangalifu na idadi ya elementi za lenzi zinazohitajika kufikia urefu wa kiangalifu ni kubwa zaidi kuliko za lenzi kuu. Hili linaendelea kuwa suala lisilo la muhimu jinsi watengenezaji wa lenzi wanavyofikia viwango vya juu katika uzalizaji wa lenzi. Hii imewezesha lenzi za kukuza kutoa picha zenye ubora unaoweza kulinganishwa na ule unaofikiwa na lenzi zenye urefu msingi usiobadilika. Ubaya mwingine wa lenzi za ukuzaji ni kuwa kilango kipana zaidi (kasi) cha lenzi kwa kawaida huwa cha chini. Hii hufanya lenzi za kukuza za bei ya chini vigumu kutumia katika hali ya mwangaza duni bila mwako.
mt: The drawbacks of zoom lenses or telephoto lenses is that the security and number of elements required to achieve the telephoto length is greater than that of the main lens. This has allowed zoom lens manufacturers to achieve high quality images that can be compared to that of a fixed lens. Another drawback of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (f-stop) of a zoom lens is usually lower. This makes low light zoom lenses more difficult to use without a tripod.
ref: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.

src: Utatanishi ni kuau tekeleza ushirika na, utambulisho na, ufahamu wa ukweli wa mwisho, uungu, ukweli au Mungu. Mwamini hutafuta uzoefu wa moja kwa moja, uelewa au maarifa ya ukweli/mungu au miungu Wafuasi hutafuta njia fulani za kuishi, au mazoea ambayo yanakusudiwa kulea uzoefu huo. Imani ya mafumbo inaweza kutofautishwa na aina nyingine za imani na ibada ya kidini kwa msisitizo wake wa uzoefu wa kibinafsi wa moja kwa moja wa hali ya kipekee ya ufahamu, hasa zile za sifa za amani, maarifa, raha au hata msisimko.
mt: 1. To practice, to proclaim, and to know the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth. Believers seek the experience of one-on-one, personal, unique, experiential knowledge, especially those of the attributes of peace, knowledge, joy, or even bliss. 2. To practice, to proclaim, and to know the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth. Believers seek the experience of one-on-one, personal, unique, experiential knowledge, especially those of the attributes of peace, knowledge, joy, or even bliss. 8. To practice, to proclaim, and to know the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth. Believers seek the experience of one-on-one, personal, unique, experiential knowledge, especially those of the attributes of peace, knowledge, joy, or even bliss. 9. To practice, to proclaim, and to know the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth.
ref: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties. Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.

src: Kwa muda mrefu wakati wa karne za kumi na tisa na ishirini, iliaminika wakazi wa kwanza wa Nyuzilandi walikuwa watu wa Maori, waliowinda ndege wakubwa walioitwa moa. Basi nadharia ikaanzisha wazo kwamba watu wa Maori walihama kutoka Polynesia katika Kundi Kubwa na kuchukua Nyuzilandi kutoka kwa Moriori, na kuanzisha jamii ya kilimo. Hata hivyo, ushahidi mpya unadokeza kwamba Moriori walikuwa kundi la Maori wa bara waliohama kutoka Nyuzilandi hadi Visiwa vya Chatham, na wakakuza utamaduni wao wenyewe wa kipekee na wenye amani. Kulikuwa pia na makabila mengine kwenye visiwa vya Chatham, ambao walikuwa Maori waliohamia Nyuzilandi. Walijiita Moriori kulikuwa na mapigano machache na mwishowe, Moriori wakauawa wote
mt: For many centuries during the 19th and 20th centuries, it was believed that the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori, who arrived in large canoes called moa. The theory began with the idea that the Maori came from Polynesia in the Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, and began a farming society. However, new evidence shows that the Moriori were a land-based Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, and developed their own unique and peaceful culture. There were also other tribes on the Chatham Islands, who were Maori who migrated to New Zealand. They were called Moriori when there were few conflicts and the Moriori were all killed
ref: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out

src: Pureland origami ni origami yenye kizuizi kwamba ni kunjo moja tu linaweza fanywa kwa wakati Fulani, kunjo ngumu zaidi kama kunjo za nyuma haziruhusiwi, na kunjo zote zina maeneo moja kwa moja. Iliundwa na John Smith miaka ya 1970 kusaidia folda walio na ujuzi kidogo au walio na ustadi kidogo wa gari.
mt: Pureland origami is origami with restrictions that only one fold can be done at a time, more difficult folds such as back folds are not allowed, and all folds have one step each. It was invented by John Smith in the 1970s to help folders with little or no experience or training.
ref: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.

src: Ustaarabu wa Indus Valley ulikuwa wa Enzi za Shaba kaskazini magharibi mwa bara ndogo la Hindi, ukijumuisha kwa wingi Pakistani ya sasa na sehemu za kaskazini magharibi mwa Hindu na kaskazini magharibi mwa Afganistani. Ustaarabu ulinawiri katika bonde la Mto Indus ambapo ulitoa jina lake. Ingawa baadhi ya wasomi hukisia kwamba kwa sababu ustaarabu pia ulikuwapo katika mabonde ya Mto Sarasvati uliokauka sasa, unafaa kuitwa Ustaarabu wa Indus-Sarasvati, huku wengine wakiuita Ustaarabu wa Harappa, kutokana na Harappa, eneo lake la kwanza kuchimbwa katika miaka ya 1920.
mt: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilization (3300–1300 BCE) in the northwestern regions of South Asia, extending from modern-day northeast Afghanistan, through northwestern Pakistan, and into western and northern India. The Indus Valley Civilization was one of the largest early urban civilizations, along with Ancient Egypt and Mesopotamia. The Indus Valley Civilization was contemporaneous with the Vedic civilization in the eastern Ganges Basin, and with the Mesopotamian civilizations in the west. There is evidence of a sophisticated and well-planned urban civilization, with advanced systems of urban planning and sewage systems, and with community baths. ref: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.

src: Tamaa na ubinafsi siku zote zitakuwa nasi na ni hali ya ushirikiano kwamba wakati wengi wanafaidika siku zote kutakuwa na mengi ya kufaidi kwa muda mfupi kwa kutenda kiubinafsi. Kwa matumaini, watu wengi watagundua kwamba chaguo lao bora la kudumu ni kufanya kazi pamoja na wengine.
mt: Greed and selfishness will be with us every day and it will be a state of cooperation that when most people benefit every day there will be many things to benefit for a short time by acting selfishly. Hopefully, many people will realize that their best choice is to work together with others.
ref: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.

src: Matumizi ya kivita kwa ubeberu wa Marekani katika ushindi dhidi ya Ufilipino yaligharimiwa na watu wa Ufilipino wenyewe. Walilazimishwa kulipa kodi kwa serikali ya wakoloni ya Amerika ili kugharamia sehemu kubwa ya matumizi na riba juu ya dhamana zilizowekwa kwa jina la serikali ya Ufilipino kupitia nyumba za benki za Wall Street. Bila shaka, faida kubwa kutokana na dhuluma za muda mrefu za watu wa Ufilipino ziliunda mapato ya msingi ya ubeberu wa Marekani.
mt: The use of force by the United States against the Philippines in its victory over the Philippines was condemned by Filipinos themselves. They were forced to pay taxes to the colonial government of America to subsidize most of the use and interest on loans made in the name of the Philippine government through the houses of Wall Street banks. No doubt, the great profits from the long-term oppression of Filipinos built the basic income of the United States.
ref: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses. Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.

src: Ili kuelewa templar ni lazima mtu aelewe muktadha ambao ulisababisha uundaji wa agizo. Kipindi ambacho matukio yalitokea kwa kawaida hujulikana kama Enzi za Juu za kati, kipindi katika historia ya Ulaya katika Karne za 11, 12, na 13 (1000-1300 Baada ya Kristo). Enzi za Juu za Kati zilitanguliwa na Enzi za Mapema za Kati na kufuatiwa na Enzi za Mwisho za Kati, ambazo kwa mapatano zinaishia karibu 1500.
mt: To understand the Templar, one must understand the order that led to its creation. The period in which the events usually occurred is known as the High Middle Ages, a period in the history of Europe in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (1000-1300 AD). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention end around 1500.
ref: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.

src: Tabia za kijeshi za Milki ya Kirumi zilisaidia sana kwa maendeleo ya matibabu. Madaktari walianza kuajiriwa na Mtawala Augustus na hata kuunda kitengo kikubwa cha kwanza cha Matibabu cha Kirumi kwa ajili ya kutumika baada ya vita. Madaktari wa upasuaji walikuwa na uelewa wa vitulizo kadhaa zikiwamo mofini kutoka kwa mbegu za mpopi na scopolamina kutoka kwa mbegu za henbeni. Walipata kuwa na ustadi wa kukata viungo vya mwili ili kuokoa wagonjwa kutokana na gangrini na vile vile mafundo na vibanio vya mishipa ili kutuliza mtiririko wa damu. Katika karne nyingi, milki ya Kirumi ilipelekea faida kubwa katika uga wa tiba na ikaunda mengi ya maarifa tunayoyajua leo.
mt: The Roman military was instrumental in the spread of medicine. The first hospital was established in Rome in 292 AD by Emperor Augustus. The first medical school was established in Rome in 857 AD by Pope Nicholas I. The Romans were the first to use anesthesia, and they were the first to use antiseptics. ref: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.

src: Uonaji, au uwezo wa kuona hutegemea viungo vya hisia vya mfumo wa kuona au macho. Kuna miundo tofauti ya macho, yaliyo ya utata tofauti kulingana na mahitaji ya kiumbe. Miundo tofauti ina uwezo tofauti, ni myepesi kwa masafa tofauti ya mawimbi na yana viwango tofauti vya ukali, pia inahitaji uchakataji tofauti ili kuelewa ingizo na nambari tofauti ili kufanya kazi kwa ubora.
mt: Vision, or the ability to see, depends on the visual system or eyes. There are different types of eyes, each having different abilities, different sensitivities to different wavelengths of light, different resolutions, and different limits to light intensity and sensitivity. Different types of eyes also have different optimal resolutions and limits of resolution.
ref: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes. There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.

src: "Kalasinga ni dini kutoka bara ndogo la India. Ilianzia eneo la Punjab katika karne ya 15 kutokana na mgawanyiko wa kimadhehebu katika tamaduni za Kihindu. Makalasinga huchukulia imani yao kuwa kando na Uhindu ingawa wanatambua mizizi na tamaduni zake katika Ubaniani. Sikhs huiita dini yao Gurmat, ambayo ni Kipunjabi kwa ""njia ya guru"". Guru ni kipengele msingi cha dini zote za India lakini Ukalasinga umechukua umuhimu ambao hubuni msingi wa imani za Kalasinga. Dini ilianzishwa karne ya 15 na Guru Nanak 1469-1539). Palifuatilia urithi wa walimu tisa."
mt: "Sikhism is a religion originating from the small Indian state of Punjab in the 15th century as a result of a schism in Hinduism. Sikhs consider their faith to be distinct from Hinduism, although they recognize the roots and traditions of Hinduism in Sikhism. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for "the way of the guru". Guru is a key concept in all Indian religions but Sikhism has taken the importance that is given to gurus in Indian religions and made it the basis of Sikhism. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469-1539) and followed by ten successive gurus."
ref: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."

src: "Tatizo la Upungufu wa Umakini ""ni ugonjwa wa neva ambao dalili zake tatu za kawaida za kuufafanua ni msukumo, mvurugo na utendaji wa kupita kiasi au nguvu za ziada."" Si ulemavu wa kusoma, ni mvurugiko wa kusoma; “unaathiri asilimia 3 hadi 5 ya watoto wote, pengine takriban watoto milioni 2 wa Marekani”. Watoto walio na ADD huwa na wakati mgumu kuangazia mambo kama kazi za shuleni, lakini wanaweza kukazia fikira mambo wanayopenda kuyafanya kama kucheza michezo au kutazama katuni zao vibwedo au kuandika sentensi bila kuakifisha. Watoto hawa huingia kwenye shida nyingi kwa sababu “wanajihusisha na tabia hatari, wanaingia kwenye vita na kuipa changamoto mamlaka” ili kuchechemua akili zao kwa sababu akili zao haziwezi kuchechemuliwa kwa njia za kawaida. Ugonjwa wa Upungufu wa Usikivu huathiri uhusiano wao na wenzi wengine kwa sababu watoto wengine hawawezi kuelewa kwa nini wao hujifanya kwa njia hiyo au kwa nini wao huduwaa jinsi wanavyofanya au kwamba kiwango cha kukomaa kwao ni tofauti."
mt: "Attention Deficit Disorder" is a neurological disorder whose three most common symptoms are hyperactivity, impulsivity, and inattention. It is not a reading disability; it is a reading disorder. "It affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps 2 million American children." ADD children have a hard time focusing on things like schoolwork, but they can focus on things they like to do, like playing games or looking at their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children do not get into many problems because "they get involved in dangerous behaviors, they get into fights and give authorities a challenge" because their brains cannot be challenged in the usual ways. Attention Deficit Disorder affects their relationships with other children because other children cannot understand why they are acting that way or why they are withdrawing or why their level of maturity is different.
ref: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy"". It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it ""affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children"". Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they ""engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority"" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods. ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different."

src: Wakati elimu ya msingi wa mradi kunapaswa kufanya elimu kuwa rahisi na ya kupendeza zaidi, udungu huenda hatua zaidi. Mbinu za mafunzo si njia ya kusoma lakini huduma ambayo hutoa usaidizi kwa watu ambao wanapitia hali mpya ya masomo kama vile kutumia programu mpya ya kompyuta au kuanza mradi mpya. Majukwaa yanaweza kuwa dhahiri na pia halisi, kwa maneno mengine, mwalimu ni aina ya jukwaa lakini pia ndivyo kilivyo kile kijitu cha karatasi katika Microsoft Office. Majukwaa Pepe yamewekwa ndani ya programu kwa kusudi la kuhoji, kushawishi, na kuelezea taratibu ambazo huenda zilikuwa changamoto kubwa kwa mwanafunzi kushughulikia peke yake.
mt: When primary education is supposed to make learning easier and more enjoyable, it may be too much. Teaching methods are not reading but service that provides assistance to people who are going through a new learning process such as using a new computer program or starting a new project. Classrooms can be obvious and also true, in other words, a teacher is a type of classroom but also that little icon in Microsoft Office. The Pepe classes have been placed within the program for the purpose of questioning, encouraging, and explaining procedures that may have been a big challenge for the student to handle alone.
ref: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.

src: MySpace ni tovuti ya tatu kwa umaarufu inayotumika nchini Marekani na ina wasajili milioni 54 sasa hivi. Tovuti hizi zimepata umakinifu mwingi sana, hasa katika mpangilio wa kielimu. Kuna vipengele chanya kuhusu tovuti hizi, ambazo ni pamoja na, kuwa rahisi kusanidi ukurasa wa darasa ambao unaweza kutia ndani blogu, video, picha, na vipengele vingine. Ukurasa huu unaweza kufikiwa kwa urahisi kwa kutoa anwani moja tu ya wavuti, ambayo inaifanya kuwa rahisi kukumbuka na rahisi kuchapa kwa wanafunzi ambao wanaweza kuwa na shida kutumia kibodi au na tahajia. Inaweza kugeuzwa ili iwe rahisi kusoma na pia na rangi nyingi au kidogo kama inavyonuiwa.
mt: MySpace is the third most popular website in the United States and has 54 million registered users. These sites have received a lot of attention, especially in the educational field. There are some unique features about these sites, including, being easy to access a classroom page that can be placed inside a blog, video, pictures, and other features. This page can be easily accessed by providing one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to do for students who may have difficulty using a keyboard or with spelling. It can be customized to be easy to read and also with many colors or a little as it is seen.
ref: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently. These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting. There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features. This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.

src: Hata hivyo, mnamo Juni 1956, ahadi za Kruschev ziliwekwa katika jaribio wakati maandamano katika Polandi, ambapo wafanyakazi walikuwa wakipinga upungufu wa chakula na kukatwa kwa mishahara, yaligeuka kuwa maandamano ya jumla dhidi ya Ukomunisti. Ingawa hatimaye, Kruschev alituma vifaru kurejesha utulivu, aliridhia baadhi ya mahitaji ya kiuchumi na akakubali kumteua mtu maarufu Wladyslaw Gomulka kama waziri mkuu mpya.
mt: However, in June 1956, promises of Kruschev were put to the test in Poland, where workers were protesting food shortages and wage cuts, which turned into a general strike against Communism. Eventually, Kruschev sent in tanks to restore order, but agreed to some economic demands and accepted the appointment of a new prime minister, Wladyslaw Gomulka.
ref: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

src: Ujerumani ilikuwa adui wa kawaida katika Vita vya Pili vya Dunia, hivyo kupelekea ushirikiano wa USSR na Marekani. Kwa kumalizika kwa vita mgongano wa mfumo, mchakato na utamaduni vilipelekea kutengana kwa nchi. Na miaka mbili ya kumalizika kwa vita, washirika wa zamani waligeuka kuwa maadui na Vita Baridi vikaanza. Ilikuwa idumu kwa miaka 40 ijayo na ingepigwa kwa kweli na vikosi vya kiwakala, katika nyanja za vita toka Afrika hadi Asia, katika Afghanistani, Kuba na sehemu nyingine nyingi
mt: Germany was a common enemy in World War II, thus leading to the alliance of USSR and USA. With the end of the war, the process and culture led to the separation of the countries. And two years after the end of the war, former allies became enemies and the Cold War began. It lasted for 40 years and was truly fought by proxy armies, in the battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and other places
ref: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out. With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began. It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.

src: Mfumo wa neva hudumisha hali ya ndani kwa kutuma mipwito ya neva mwilini kote ili kudumisha mkondo wa damu pia bila usumbufu. Mipwito hii ya neva inaweza kutumwa haraka sana mwilini kote ambayo huweka mwili salama dhidi ya hatari yoyote.
mt: The body's circulatory system delivers oxygen to every cell in the body, and also carries away waste products. This oxygen delivery system can be quickly shut down in the event of an emergency, keeping the body safe from any danger.
ref: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.

src: "Piramidi kuu katika Giza ndiyo ya pekee ya maajabu saba ambayo bado inasimama leo. Piramidi Kuu iliyojengwa na Wamisri katika karne ya tatu BCE ni mojawapo ya majengo makubwa yaliyojengwa kwa heshima ya Firauni waliofariki. Kilima cha Giza, au ""Giza Necropolis"" katika Bonde la Wafu la Misri kina piramidi kadhaa (ambazo piramidi kuu ni kubwa zaidi), makaburi kadhaa madogo, hekalu kadhaa, na Sphinx kuu. Piramidi kuu iliundwa ili kumheshimu Firauni Khufu, na piramidi, makaburi na mahekalu mengine mengi madogo yalijengwa ili kuheshimu wake na wanafamilia wa Khufu."
mt: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is one of the seven wonders of the ancient world that still stands today. The Great Pyramid was built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE to honor Pharaoh Khufu. The Giza Necropolis, or "Giza Plateau," in Egypt contains several pyramids (the Great Pyramid is the largest), smaller tombs, and temples. The Great Pyramid was built to honor Pharaoh Khufu, and the other pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu and his family."
ref: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."

src: Hekalu ya Artemis kule Ephesus iliharibiwa julai 21, 356 BCE kwa kisa cha moto kilichotekelezwa na Herostratus. Kulingana na hadithi, motisha wake ulikuwa umaarufu kwa gharama yoyote. Waefeso, kwa kukasirika, walitangaza kuwa jina la Herostratus lisirekodiwe daima. Mwanahistoria wa Kigiriki Strabo alibaini hilo jina, ambalo ndilo tunavyolijua leo. Hekalu liliharibiwa usiku ule ule Alexander Mkuu alizaliwa. Alexander, kama mfalme, alijitolea kugharimia ujenzi upya wa hekalu, lakini toleo lake lilikataliwa. Baadaye, baada ya Alexander kufa, hekalu lilijengwa upya mnamo 323 BCE.
mt: 21 July 356 BCE, the Temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed by fire, allegedly set by Herostratus. According to legend, his motive was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, in their outrage, declared that the name of Herostratus should never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo identified this name, which is what we know today. The temple was destroyed that night Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to rebuild the temple, but his offer was refused. Later, after Alexander's death, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.
ref: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.

src: Namna yak kwanza ya uchukuzi iliyofahamika ni kutembea, binadaum walianza kutembea wima miaka milioni mbili iliyopita, baada ya kuibuka kwa wanadamu wima. Watangulizi wao, Australopithecus hawakutembea wima kama kawaida. Utaalamu wa bipedali unapatikana katika visukuku vya Australopithekasi kuanzia miaka milion 4.2 hadi 3.9 iliyopita, ingawa inawezekana kuwa Sahelanthropasi walitembea kwa miguu miwili takriban miaka milioni saba iliyopita.
mt: The first known method of locomotion is walking, bipedalism began in humans millions of years ago, after the emergence of humans. Their ancestors, Australopithecus did not walk bipedally as usual. Bipedalism is found in Australopithecan fossils from 4.2 to 3.9 million years ago, although it is possible that Sahelanthropus walked bipedally about seven million years ago.
ref: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually. Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.

src: Kutumia meli kusafirisha bidhaa kwa kiasi kikubwa ilikuwa njia bora zaidi ya kusafirisha halaiki ya watu na bidhaa nyingi baharini. Kazi ya Jeshi la wanamaji kwa kiasili imekuwa ni kuhakikisha kuwa nchi yako ina uwezo wa kusafirisha watu na bidhaa zako, wakati huo huo, kuzuia uwezo wa adui wako wa kuhamisha watu wake na bidhaa. Mojawapo ya mifano maarufu ya hivi karibuni ni kampeni ya Kaskazini mwa Atlantiki ya Vita Vikuu vya Pili vya Dunia. Wamarekani walikuwa wakijaribu kusafirisha watu na vifaa kupitia Bahari ya Atlantiki ili kuwasaidia Waingereza. Wakati huo huo, askari wa majeshi ya Ujerumani, kwa kutumia nyambizi, yalikuwa yakijaribu kuzuia trafiki hii. Ikiwa Muungano ungeshindwa, pengine Ujerumani ingeweza kushinda Uingereza kama vile ilivyokuwa imeshinda Uropa.
mt: Using ships to transport goods was the best way to move people and goods across the sea. The Navy's original job was to make sure your country had the ability to move people and goods, while at the same time preventing your enemy from moving their people and goods. One of the most famous examples of this is the North Atlantic Campaign of World War II. The Americans were trying to move people and supplies across the Atlantic to help the British. At the same time, the German Army was trying to prevent this traffic. If the Allies had failed, perhaps Germany would have won Europe.
ref: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.

src: Uvumbuzi wa magurudumu ya spoki ulifanya magari ya Ashuru yawe mepesi, haraka, na yaliyo tayari zaidi kushinda askari na magari mengine. Mishale kutoka kwenye nyuta zao hatari ingeweza kupenya ngao za askari wapinzani. Takribani 1000 BC, Waashuru walianzisha farasi wa kwanza wa vita. Askari farasi ni jeshi linalopigana juu ya farasi. Matandiko yalikuwa bado hayajavumbuliwa, kwa hivyo askari farasi wa Ashuru walipigana kwenye migongo tupu ya farasi wao.
mt: 1000 BC, the Assyrians invented the first war chariot. Chariot cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. Tactics had not yet been invented, so Assyrian chariot cavalry fought on the backs of their young horses.
ref: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.

src: Wababeli waliwajengea kila mmoja wa miungu yao hekalu la msingi ambalo lilizingatiwa kuwa nyumba ya mungu huyo. Watu wangeleta dhabihu kwa miungu na makuhani wangejaribu kushughulikia mahitaji ya miungu kupitia sherehe na tamasha. Kila kasri lilikuwa na uwanja wazi wa kasri na kisha mahali pa ndani patakatifu ambamo ni makasisi tu wangeweza kuingia. Wakati mwingine piramidi maalum zenye umbo la mnara, zinazoitwa ziggurat, zilijengwa ili ziwe sehemu ya hekalu. Sehemu ya juu ilikuwa makao matakatifu ya mungu.
mt: 1. The ancient Hebrews built each one of their gods a temple, which was considered the house of that god. People would bring sacrifices to the god and priests would try to meet the god's needs through ceremonies and festivals. Each shrine had an open courtyard and then an inner sanctum where only priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramidal structures, called ziggurats, were built to be part of the temple. The upper part was the holy place of the god.
ref: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.

src: Wababeli waliwajengea kila mmoja wa miungu yao hekalu la msingi ambalo lilizingatiwa kuwa nyumba ya mungu huyo. Watu wangeleta dhabihu kwa miungu na makuhani wangejaribu kushughulikia mahitaji ya miungu kupitia sherehe na tamasha. Kila kasri lilikuwa na uwanja wazi wa kasri na kisha mahali pa ndani patakatifu ambamo ni makasisi tu wangeweza kuingia. Wakati mwingine piramidi maalum zenye umbo la mnara, zinazoitwa ziggurat, zilijengwa ili ziwe sehemu ya hekalu. Sehemu ya juu ilikuwa makao matakatifu ya mungu.
mt: 1. The ancient Hebrews built each one of their gods a temple, which was considered the house of that god. People would bring sacrifices to the god and priests would try to meet the god's needs through ceremonies and festivals. Each shrine had an open courtyard and then an inner sanctum where only priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramidal structures, called ziggurats, were built to be part of the temple. The upper part was the holy place of the god.
ref: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.

src: Ndiyo! Mfalme Tutankhamuni, ambaye wakati mwingine hutambuliwa kama “Mfalme Tuti” au “Mfalme Mvulana”, ni mmojawapo wa wafalme wa zamani wa Misri wanaojulikana sana katika nyakati za sasa. Kwa kushangaza, hakuchukuliwa kuwa muhimu katika zamani za kale na hakurekodiwa kwenye nyingi za orodha za wafalme. Hata hivyo, ugunduzi wa kaburi lake mnamo 1922 ulimfanya mtu mashuhuri. Huku makaburi mengi ya zamani yakiporwa, kaburi hili liliachwa karibu bila kusumbuliwa kamwe. Vitu vingi vilivyozikwa na Tutankhamun vimehifadhiwa vizuri, ikiwa ni pamoja na maelfu ya sanaa zilizoundwa kutoka kwa madini ya thamani na mawe adimu.
mt: Yes! King Tutankhamun, who is sometimes identified as “King Tut” or “Boy King”, is one of the ancient kings of Egypt who is well known in modern times. It is surprising that he was not considered important in ancient times and was not recorded in many lists of kings. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a famous person. While many ancient tombs were excavated, this tomb was left undisturbed almost without any disturbance. Many things buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including a large number of artworks made from valuable minerals and precious stones.
ref: "Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as ""King Tut"" or ""The Boy King"", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones."

src: Tunawajua wengi wa wanasiasa, wanasayansi na wasanii wa Ugiriki. Yamkini mtu anayejulikana sana katika utamaduni huu ni Homer, malenga wa mashairi aliyekuwa kipofu, aliyebuni tungo mbili bora sana za fasihi ya Kigiriki: mashairi Iliad na Odyssey. Sophocles na Aristophanes bado ni waandishi maarufu wa michezo ya kuigiza na michezo yao huzingatiwa kuwa miongoni mwa kazi kubwa za fasihi ya ulimwengu. Mgiriki mwingine maarufu ni Pythagoras, anayejulikana sana kwa nadharia zake maarufu za hisabati kuhusu uhusiano wa pande za pembe tatu zenye pembemraba.
mt: We know many of the Greek politicians, scientists and artists. I think a well-known person in this culture is Homer, a blind poet who invented two great works of Greek literature: the epics Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still well-known playwrights and their plays are considered among the greatest works of world literature. Another Greek is Pythagoras, who is well-known for his famous mathematical theories about the relationship of the three parts of a triangle.
ref: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature. Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.

src: Katika hali joto ya hewa ya Mashariki ya Kati, nyumba haikuwa muhimu sana. Sehemu kubwa ya maisha ya familia ya Kiebrania ilifanyikia nje. Wanawake walifanya mapishi kwenye yadi; stoo zilikuwa kaunta wazi tu zilizoelekea barabarani. Mawe yalitumika kujengea barabara. Hakukua na misitu mikubwa kwenye ardhi ya Canaan, kwa hivyo mbao ziliuzwa kwa bei ghali mno.
mt: In the hot climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the family's life took place outside. Women cooked on open hearths; tables were just benches that faced the street. Stones were used to build roads. There were not large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was expensive.
ref: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air. Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.

src: Greenland ilikuwa na watu chache. Katika Norse sagas wanasema kwamba Erik aliye Mwekundu alifukuzwa kutoka Iceland kwa mauaji, na wakati wa kusafiri Magharibi zaidi, aliipata Greenland na kuiita Greenland. Lakina licha ya ugunduzi wake, makabila ya Eskimo yalikuwa tayari yanaishi huko wakati huo. Ingawa kila nchi ilikuwa ya 'Kiskandinavia', kulikuwa na tofauti nyingi kati ya watu, wafalme, mila na historia za Denmaki, Uswidi, Norway na Aislandi.
mt: Greenland was sparsely populated. In Norse sagas, it is said that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when he sailed further west, he found Greenland and named it Greenland. However, despite its discovery, the Inuit had already been living there at the time. Although all the countries were of 'Scandinavia', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and histories of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.
ref: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland. But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time. Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.

src: Wakati nyingi ya vyakula vyao tunavifahamu, Warumi walikuwa na sehemu yao ya vitu vya karamu vya kushangaza au visivyo vya kawaida, pamoja na nguruwe mwitu, tausi, konokono, na aina ya panya inayoitwa dormouse Tofauti nyingine ilikuwa kwamba huku watu masikini na mwanamke wakila chakula chao huku wameketi kwenye viti, watu tajiri walipenda kuwa na karamu pamoja ambapo wangepumzika kwa upande huku wakila vyakula vyao. Milo ya kale ya Kiroma haingejumuisha vyakula vilivyoingia Uropa kutoka Marekani au kutoka Asia katika karne za baadaye. Kwa mfano, hawakuwa na mahindi, wala nyanya, wala viazi, wala kakao, na hakuna Mrumi wa zamani aliyewahi kuonja batamzinga.
mt: While we are familiar with many of their foods, Romans had their share of strange or unusual dishes, including wild boar, peacock, ostrich, dormouse and a type of rat called dormouse. Other differences included the poor eating their meals while sitting on the floor, while the rich preferred to dine at a table, reclining while eating their food. Roman wine did not include the foods that entered Europe from America or Asia in later centuries. For example, they did not have corn, or tomatoes, or potatoes, or cocoa, and there was no Mr. Peanut.
ref: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals. Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.
