src: Ustaarabu ni utamaduni wa umoja unaoshirikiwa na kundi kubwa la watu wanaoishi na kufanya kazi kwa kushirikiana, jamii. Neno ustaarabu hutoka katika civilis la Kilatini, ambalo linamaanisha ya kiraia, linalohusiana na civis la Kilatini, linalomaanisha raia, na civitas, linalomaanisha mji au jimbo la mji, na ambalo kwa namna fulani linaelezea ukubwa wa jamii. Majimbo ya miji hutanguliza mataifa. Utamaduni wa kistaarabu huashiria kupitishwa kwa maarifa katika vizazi kadhaa, wayo wa kitamaduni unaoendelea kukaa kwa muda na usambazaji wenye haki. Tamaduni ndogo mara nyingi hutoweka bila kuacha ushahidi muhimu wa kihistoria na kukosa kutambuliwa kama ustaarabu barabara.

ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: Drukgyal Dzong ni ngome iliyoharibika na monasteri ya Kibudhi katika sehemu ya juu ya Wilaya ya Paro (katika Kijiji cha Phondrey). Inasemekana kwamba mnamo 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel aliunda ngome hiyo kama ukumbusho wa ushindi wake dhidi ya vikosi vya Tibeti na Mongoli. Mnamo 1951, moto ulifanya baadhi tu ya masalio ya Drukgyal Dzong kubakia, kama vile picha ya Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. Baada ya moto, ngome ilihifadhiwa na kulindwa, na kubaki kuwa mojawapo ya vivutio vya kusisimua zaidi vya Bhutan.
mt: Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined dzong (fortress) in the upper Paro valley above Paro Dzong. It is believed that the Drukgyal Dzong was built in 1649 by Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal to commemorate his victory over the Tibetans. In 1951, a fire destroyed most of the Drukgyal Dzong, leaving only the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the Drukgyal Dzong was preserved and protected, and it remains one of the most visited sites in Bhutan.
ref: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

src: Wakati wa karne ya 18 Kambodia ilijipata imebanwa katikati mwa majirani wawili wenye nguvu, Thailandi na Vietnam. Wathai walivamia Kambodia mara kadhaa katika karne ya 18 na mnamo 1772 wakaangamiza Phnom Phen. Katika miaka ya mwisho ya karne ya 18 Wavietinamu pia waliivamia Kambodia.
mt: 18th century Cambodia was devastated by its powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thai invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Penh. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: Wakati wa karne ya 18 Kambodia ilijipata imebanwa katikati mwa majirani wawili wenye nguvu, Thailandi na Vietnam. Wathai walivamia Kambodia mara kadhaa katika karne ya 18 na mnamo 1772 wakaangamiza Phnom Phen. Katika miaka ya mwisho ya karne ya 18 Wavietinamu pia waliivamia Kambodia.
mt: 18th century Cambodia was devastated by its powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thai invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Penh. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: Taiwan ilianza nyuma kitambo katika karne ya 15 ambapo mabaharia wa Kiingereza wanaopita hurekodi jina la kisiwa hicho kama Ilha Formosa, au kisiwa kizuri. Mnamo 1624, kampuni ya Dutch East India ilianzisha msingi kusini magharibi mwa Taiwan, kuanzisha mabadiliko katika mazoea ya uzalishaji wa nafaka na kuwaajili wafanyakazi wa Kichina kufanya kazi kwenye mashamba ya mpunga na sukari. Mnamo 1683, vikosi vya nasaba ya Qing (1644-1912) vilichukua udhibiti wa maeneo ya pwani ya magharibi na kaskazini ya Taiwan na kutangaza Taiwan kama mkoa wa Milki ya Qing mnamo 1885. Mnamo 1895, baada ya kushindwa katika vita vya kwanza vya Sino-Japani (1894-1895), serikali ya Qing yatia sahihi mkataba wa Shimonoseki, ambao kwao inadhihirisha uhuru juu ya Taiwan hadi Japani, ambayo inaongoza kisiwa hadi 1945.
mt: 15th century, when Portuguese sailors passing by recorded the name of the island as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624, the Dutch East India Company established a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating changes in the island's agricultural production and recruiting Chinese laborers to work on sugar and rice plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty troops took control of the island's western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after losing the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signed the Treaty of Shimonoseki, which ceded Taiwan to Japan, which ruled the island until 1945.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: Hii inaitwa pH ya kemikali. Unaweza kutengeneza kiashiria kutumia juisi ya kabichi nyekundu. Sharubati ya kabichi hubadilisha rangi kulingana na uasidi au ubesi (ualkali) wa kemikali. Kiwango cha pH huashiriwa na kiasi cha ioni za Hidrojeni (H katika pH) kwenye kemikali iliyofanyiwa jaribio. Ioni za Hidrojeni ni protoni ambazo zilibambuliwa elektroni zazo (kwani atomu za Hidrojeni huwa na protoni moja na elektroni moja).
mt: This is called the pH of a chemical. You can make a pH indicator using red cabbage juice. The color of the cabbage juice changes according to the acidity or alkalinity (basicity) of the chemical. The pH is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen ions (H in pH) in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that have lost their electrons (since Hydrogen atoms have one proton and one electron).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: Simba ni baadhi ya wanyama wa jamii ya paka wanaopenda ujamii zaidi, na wanaishi katika vikundi vikubwa vinavyoitwa prides. Makundi ya simba yanatengenezwa na waume kati ya mmoja na watatu wazima wanaohusiana, pamoja na wengi wa kike kama thelathini na mashibli. Wanawake kawaida ndio uhusiana sana wao kwa wao, kwa kuwa familia kubwa ya madada na mabinti. Makundi ya simba hutenda kama makundi ya mbwa mwitu au mbwa, wanyama ambao kwa kushangaza ni sawa na simba (lakini si paka wengine wakubwa) kitabia, na pia ni hatari kwa mawindo yao.
mt: Lions are members of the family Felidae, which also includes the cheetah, jaguar, leopard, puma, and other species. Lions are the only cats that live in groups, which are called prides. Prides are made up of related females, their cubs, and a few adult males. Female lions are the primary hunters, and they work together to bring down large prey. Lions are the only cats that live in groups, which are called prides. Prides are made up of related females, their cubs, and a few adult males. Female lions are the primary hunters, and they work together to bring down large prey.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: Chini yake kunao paka zaidi zenye mwili wa wastani ambao hula mawindo yenye mwili wa wastani kuanzia sungura hadi swara na kulungu. Mwishowe, kuna paka wengi wadogo (wakiwemo paka huru vipenzi) ambao hula mawindo madogomadogo ambayo ni mengi, kama wadudu, panya, mijusi, na ndege. Siri ya mafanikio yao ni dhana ya niche, kazi maalum ambayo kila paka anashikilia na inayomzuia kushindana na wengine.
mt: Below them are larger animals with average-sized bodies that eat average-sized prey, from rabbits to deer and elk. Finally, there are many small animals (including beloved pets) that eat small prey, such as insects, mice, squirrels, and birds. The secret of their success is niche, a specialized job that each animal holds and that protects them from competition.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: Paka mwitu hupenda kula wanyama wadogo. Hushika tumbili, nyoka, panya na ndege kama wanaweza. Karibu wanyama wote ambao paka mwitu huwinda ni wadogo kumliko. Wanasayansi wanafikiria kwamba paka mwitu hufuata na kutafuta wanyama wa kula (windo) kwa harufu, kunusa ili kutafuta walikokuwa ardhini. Wanaweza kuona vizuri sana kwa giza na maono ya usiku pia wanasonga kwa kimya sana. Ocelots huwinda mawindo yao kwa kujichanganya na mazingira yao kasha kurukia mawindo yao.
mt: Wild cats like to eat small animals. They catch rabbits, snakes, rats and birds as they can. All animals that wild cats hunt are small to eat. Scientists think that wild cats follow and look for prey (windo) by smell, saliva to find what was on the ground. They can see very well in the dark and are very fast. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings to sneak up on their prey.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: Mwanariadha wa mambo anuwai, simbamarara anaweza kupanda (ingawa si vizuri), kuogelea, kuruka mbali sana na kuvuta kwa nguvu mara tano ya zile za mwanamume mwenye nguvu. Chui yuko kwenye kundi moja (jenasi panther) na simba, lengau na chui wa America ya kusini na kati. Hawa paka wanne pekee ndio wanaoweza kunguruma. Mgurumo wa simbamarara si kama mgurumo mkubwa wa simba, bali ni zaidi kama sentensi ya kemeo yenye maneno yanayotolewa kwa kelele.
mt: A female cheetah can run (although not very well), jump, sprint, and pull five times the weight of a man. The cheetah is one of four species (genus Panthera) that can run. Cheetah sprinting is not like a lion's, but more like a sentence with words spoken in a whisper.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: Seli ni sehemu ndogo ya kimuundo na ya kazi ya viumbe (vitu) hai. Seli linatokana na neno cella la Kilatini ambalo humaanisha chumba kidogo. Ukitazama vitu vyenye uhai chini ya hadubini, utaona kwamba vimeudwa kwa miraba au mipira midogo. Robert Hooke, mtaalamu wa biolojia kutoka Uingereza, aliona miraba midogo kwenye kizibo kwa darubini. Zilionekana kama vyumba. Alikuwa mtu wa kwanza kuona seli zilizokufa.
mt: A cell is a small, basic unit of life. The word cell comes from the Latin cellula, meaning "small room." When you look at living things under a microscope, you see that they are made up of tiny rooms. Robert Hooke, an English biologist, saw tiny rooms in cork under a microscope. They looked like cells. He was the first person to see dead cells.
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: Wanyama wametengenezwa kwa seli nyingi. Wao hula vitu na kuvimeng’enyea ndani. Wanyama wengi wanaweza kusonga. Ni wanyama tu walio na bongo (ingawa hata si wanyama wote walio nazo; kwa mfano, viwavi wa baharini hawana bongo). Wanyama hupatikana duniani kote. Wanachimba ardhini, wanaogelea kwenye bahari, na wanaruka angani.
mt: Animals are made of cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals with backbones (though not all animals with backbones; for example, sea sponges don't have backbones). Animals are found all over the world. They burrow in the ground, swim in the water, and fly in the air.
ref: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: Mimea hutengeneza oksijeni ambayo binadamu hupumua, na huingiza kabonidioksidi ambayo binadamu hutoa nje (yaani, kupumua nje). Mimea hupata chakula chao kutoka kwa jua kupitia usanisinuru. Pia hupatia kuvuli Sisi hutengeneza nyumba zetu kwa mimea na kutengeneza nguo zetu kwa mimea. Chakula kingi ambacho sisi hula ni mimea. Bila mimea, wanyama hawawezi kuishi.
mt: Plants produce oxygen that humans breathe in, and take in carbon dioxide that humans breathe out (i.e., breathe out). They get their food from the sun through photosynthesis. We build our homes with plants and make our clothes with plants. The food we eat is plants. Without plants, animals cannot live.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: Mimea hutengeneza oksijeni ambayo binadamu hupumua, na huingiza kabonidioksidi ambayo binadamu hutoa nje (yaani, kupumua nje). Mimea hupata chakula chao kutoka kwa jua kupitia usanisinuru. src: Wakati kundi dogo la vitu vilivyo hai (idadi ndogo) linatenganishwa na idadi kubwa walimotoka (kama wakipita juu ya milima au mto, au wakihamia kwenye kisiwa kigeni hivi kwamba hawawezi kurudi nyuma kwa urahisi) mara nyingi watajipata katika mazingira tofauti na walimokuwa awali. Mazingira haya mapya yana rasilimali tofauti na washindani tofauti, kwa hivyo idadi mpya ya watu itahitaji vipengele au mazoea tofauti ili kuwa washindani imara kuliko walichohitaji awali. Idadi asili haijabadilika kamwe, bado wanahitaji mbinu zile zile za za awali. Kwa muda, jinsi idadi mpya inavyoanza kuzoea mazingira yao mapya, wanaanza kuonekana zaidi na zaidi tofauti na idadi ile nyingine. Mwishowe, baada ya maelfu au hata mamilioni ya miaka, wakazi hao wawili wataonekana tofauti sana kwamba hawawezi kuitwa spishi moja. Tunauita mchakato huu speciation, ambalo linamanisha uundaji wa spishi mpya. Speciation ni matokeo yasiyoweza kuepukika na sehemu muhimu sana ya mageuzi.
mt: When a small group of organisms (a small number) is separated from a large group (such as by mountains or a river, or by moving to a new island) they often find themselves in different environments and different resources and competitors, so the new group will need different traits or adaptations to be as successful as the original group. The original group has not changed at all, they still need the same traits or adaptations. For a time, as the new group begins to adapt to their new environments, they begin to look more and more different from the original group. Eventually, after thousands or millions of years, these two groups will look so different that they cannot be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which means the creation of a new species. Speciation is an irreversible process and is an important part of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: Wakati kundi dogo la vitu vilivyo hai (idadi ndogo) linatenganishwa na idadi kubwa walimotoka (kama wakipita juu ya milima au mto, au wakihamia kwenye kisiwa kigeni hivi kwamba hawawezi kurudi nyuma kwa urahisi) mara nyingi watajipata katika mazingira tofauti na walimokuwa awali. Mazingira haya mapya yana rasilimali tofauti na washindani tofauti, kwa hivyo idadi mpya ya watu itahitaji vipengele au mazoea tofauti ili kuwa washindani imara kuliko walichohitaji awali. Idadi asili haijabadilika kamwe, bado wanahitaji mbinu zile zile za za awali. Kwa muda, jinsi idadi mpya inavyoanza kuzoea mazingira yao mapya, wanaanza kuonekana zaidi na zaidi tofauti na idadi ile nyingine. Mwishowe, baada ya maelfu au hata mamilioni ya miaka, wakazi hao wawili wataonekana tofauti sana kwamba hawawezi kuitwa spishi moja. Tunauita mchakato huu speciation, ambalo linamanisha uundaji wa spishi mpya. Speciation ni matokeo yasiyoweza kuepukika na sehemu muhimu sana ya mageuzi.
mt: When a small group of organisms (a small number) is separated from a large group (such as by mountains or a river, or by moving to a new island) they often find themselves in different environments and different resources and competitors, so the new group will need different traits or adaptations to be as successful as the original group. The original group has not changed at all, they still need the same traits or adaptations. For a time, as the new group begins to adapt to their new environments, they begin to look more and more different from the original group. Eventually, after thousands or millions of years, these two groups will look so different that they cannot be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which means the creation of a new species. Speciation is an irreversible process and is an important part of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: Kiungo kikuu cha mfumo wa mzunguko ni moyo, ambao hupiga damu. Damu inatoka moyoni katika mirija inayoitwa ateri na inarudi moyoni katika mirija inayoitwa vena. Mirija midogo kabisa huitwa kapilari.
mt: The heart is the central organ of the circulatory system. Blood leaves the heart through arteries and returns through veins. Very small vessels are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Kiungo kikuu cha mfumo wa mzunguko ni moyo, ambao hupiga damu. Damu inatoka moyoni katika mirija inayoitwa ateri na inarudi moyoni katika mirija inayoitwa vena. Mirija midogo kabisa huitwa kapilari.

ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Wadudu ndio waliokuwa wanyama wa kwanza kupaa angani. Uwezo wao wa kupaa uliwasaidia kuwakwepa maadui kwa urahisi na kupata chakula na wenzi wao kwa urahisi. Wadudu wengi wana bahati ya kuweza kufunga mbawa zao mwilini. Hii huwapa fursa pana ya sehemu ndogondogo za kujificha na adui wao. Siku hizi, wadudu pekee ambao hawawezi kukunja mabawa yao kwenda nyuma ni kerengende na kipupe.
mt: Insects were the first animals to fly. Their ability to fly helped them avoid predators and find food and mates easily. Many insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back into their bodies. This gives them a large area to hide and protect themselves from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold their wings back are the grasshopper and the butterfly.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: Wanapaleontolojia wengi leo hii wanaamini kuwa kikundi kimoja cha dinosau kiliponea na kingali hai hata sasa. Tunawaita ndege. Watu wengi hawawachukuliii kuwa dinosau kwa sababu wana manyoya na wanaweza kupaa. Lakini kuna mambo mengi juu ya ndege ambao bado wanaonekana kama dinosau. Wana miguu yenye magamba na makucha, hutaga mayai na hutembea kwa miguu yake miwili ya nyuma kama T-Rex.
mt: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and evolved into birds. We fly. Many people don't think of dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are many things about birds that still look like dinosaurs. They have legs with claws, lay eggs and walk on their hind legs like T-Rex.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: Meno ya triseratopu yangeweza kuponda si majani pekee, bali pia matawi na mizizi migumu sana. Baadhi ya wanasayansi wanadhani kwamba Triseratopu walikula sikadi, ambazo ni aina ya mmea uliokuwa wa kawaida katika Kretasea. Mimea hii inaonekana kama mtende mdogo wenye taji ya majani yenye ncha kali, yenye miiba. Triseratops angeutumia mdomo wake wenye nguvu kuyatoa majani kabla ya kula shina. Wanasayansi wengine wanadai kuwa mimea hii ina sumu kali na kwa hiyo hakuna uwezekano kuwa dinosaria yeyote aliila, ingawa leo hii wavivu na wanyama wengine kama kasuku (kizazi cha dinosaria) wanaweza kula majani au matunda ya sumu.
mt: The leaves of the triceratops could not only be eaten, but also the stems and roots, which were very tough. Some scientists believe that the triceratops ate ferns, which were common in the Cretaceous. This plant looks like a small tree with a hard leaf, with thorns. The triceratops would use its powerful jaws to tear the leaves before eating the stems. Other scientists say that this plant is very poisonous and therefore it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate it, although today it is harmless and other animals such as birds (a subclass of dinosaurs) can eat the leaves or fruits of the poison.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: Timu ya soka ya Italia, pamoja na timu ya soka ya Ujerumani ndiyo timu ya pili yenye mafanikio zaidi duniani na ilikuwa bingwa wa kikombe cha dunia cha FIFA mwaka wa 2006. Michezo maarufu ni pamoja na kandanda, mpira wa kikapu, mpira wa wavu, polo ya majini, mchezo wa uzio, raga, uendeshaji baiskeli, hoki ya barafu, hoki ya gogo na mashindano ya magari ya F1. Spoti za msimu wa baridi ni maarufu sana katika maeneo ya Kaskazini, ambako Waitaliano hushindana katika michezo ya kimataifa na ya Olimpiki.
mt: The Italian national football team, along with the German national football team, is one of the most successful teams in the world and was the FIFA World Cup champion in 2006. Popular sports include fencing, basketball, water polo, skiing, curling, ice hockey, and Formula One racing. Winter sports are very popular in the northern regions, where Italians compete in international and Olympic competitions.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: Luxembourg ina historia ndefu lakini uhuru wake ni wa kutoka mwaka wa 1839. Baadhi ya sehemu za sasa za Ubelgiji zilikuwa sehemu ya Lusembagi zamani lakini zikawa za Kibelgiji baada ya Mapinduzi ya Kibelgiji ya 1830. Lusembagi daima imejaribu kuwa nchi isiyoegemea upande wowote lakini ilichukuliwa na Ujerumani katika Vita vya kwanza na vya pili vya Dunia. Mnamo 1957 Luxembourg ikawa memba mwanzilishi wa shirika ambalo leo linajulikana kama Umoja wa Ulaya.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence is from 1839. Some of the current areas of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became part of Belgium after the Belgian Revolution of 1830. Luxembourg has always tried to be a country not dependent on any side but was taken by Germany in the First and Second World Wars. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization that is now known as the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: Uturuki ya Ulaya (Thrace mashariki au Rumelia katika rasi ya Balka) inajumuisha asilimia 3 ya nchi. Wilaya ya Uturuki ni zaidi ya kilomita 1,600 (maili 1,000) urefu na kilomita 800 (maili 500) upana, na takriban umbo la mstatili. Sehemu ya Uturuki, pamoja na maziwa, imekalia kilomita mraba 783, 562 (maili mraba 300, 948), ambazo kilomita mraba 755,688 (maili mraba 291,773) kati yake ziko kusini magharibi mwa Asia na kilomita mraba 23,764 (maili mraba 9,174) ziko barani Ulaya. Eneo la Uturuki huifanya kuwa nchi ya 37 kwa ukubwa duniani, na ina takriban saizi za Ufaransa ya Uropa na Uingereza kwa pamoja. Uturuki imezungukwa na maziwa katika pande tatu: Bahari ya Aegea upande wa magharibi, Bahari Nyeusi upande wa kaskazini na Bahari ya Mediterania upande wa kusini.
mt: Eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula comprises about 3% of the country. The provinces of Turkey are more than 1,600 km (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, and approximately shaped like a rectangle. Part of Turkey, including lakes, covers 783,562 km² (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 km² (291,773 sq mi) are in southwestern Asia and 23,764 km² (9,174 sq mi) are in Europe. Turkey is the 37th largest country in the world, and is about the size of France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is surrounded by seas in three sides: the Aegean Sea in the west, the Black Sea in the north and the Mediterranean Sea in the south.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: Idadi ya watu Jijini Vatican ni takriban 800. Ndio taifa ndogo kabisa duniani lililo huru na nchi yenye idadi ndogo kabisa ya watu. Jiji la Vatikani hutumia Kiitaliano katika sheria zake na mawasiliano rasmi. Kiitaliano pia ni lugha ya kila siku inayotumika na wengi wa wale wanaofanya kazi katika serikali huku Kilatini mara nyingi kikitumika katika sherehe za kidini. Wananchi wote wa Mji wa Vatican ni Wakatoliki ya Kiroma.
mt: 800 is the population of the city of Vatican. It is the smallest country in the world with the lowest population. The city of Vatican uses Italian in its laws and official communications. Italian is also the language of everyday use by many of those who work in the government, while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of the city of Vatican are Roman Catholics.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: Tarakilishi leo hutumiwa kuumbua picha na video. Michoro ya kisasa inaweza kujengwa kwenye kompyuta, na aina hii ya uhuishaji inazidi kutumiwa kwenye runinga na filamu. Muziki kwa kawaida hurekodiwa kutumia kompyuta tata ili kuchakata na kuchanganya sauti pamoja.
mt: 3D graphics are used to create images and video. Modern computers can be used to create 3D models, and this type of processing is increasingly used in television and movies. Music is usually recorded using a computer to record and mix audio together.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: Miji ya Harappa na Mohenjo-daro ilikuwa na choo cha kisasa katika karibu kila nyumba, kilichounganishwa kwenye mfumo tata wa maji taka. Mabaki ya mfumo wa maji taka yamepatikana kwenye nyumba za miji ya Kiminoa ya Crete na Santorini katika Ugiriki. Pia kulikuwa na choo katika Misri, Uajemi na China ya kale. Katika ustaarabu wa Kirumi, wakati mwingine choo zilikuwa sehemu ya nyumba za bafu za umma ambapo waume na wake walichanganyika pamoja.
mt: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a public toilet in nearly every home, connected to a system of underground sewers. Remains of the sewer system have been found in the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in Egypt, Persia and China. In the Roman Empire, sometimes toilets were part of public bathhouses where men and women mingled together.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

In the Roman Empire, sometimes toilets were part of public bathhouses where men and women mingled together.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: Ukengele katika kibao cha kisasa cha kutelezea una ncha mbili zenye uwazi uliobonyea katikati yao. Ncha hizo mbili huruhusu kushikilia vizuri kwa barafu, hata wakati imebenuliwa. Kwa sababu ukengele umepindika kidogo upande wa chini, jinsi ukengele unavyoelekea upande mmoja au mwingine, ncha ambayo inaambatana na barafu pia inajipinda. Hii husababisha mtelezaji kugeuka. Ikiwa vitelezi vitageuka kulia, mtelezaji anageuka kulia, ikiwa vitelezi vitageuka kushoto, mtelezaji anageuka kushoto.
mt: 2D animation of a modern slide projector. The two slides are transparent and allow the viewer to see through them. Because the slide has shifted slightly, the slide that is aligned with the projector's lens also shifts. This causes the projected image to shift. If the slides shift to the right, the projected image shifts to the right, if the slides shift to the left, the projected image shifts to the left.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: "Ili kurejea katika hali yao ya awali ya nishati, ni lazima ziondoe nishati ya ziada zilizopata kutoka kwa mwangaza. Hufanya hivi kwa kutoa chembe ndogo ya mwanga inayoitwa “fotoni”. Wanasayansi huita mchakato huu ""utoaji wa mionzi uliosisimuliwa"" kwani atomu husisimuliwa na mwanga mkali, na kusababisha utoaji wa fotoni ya mwanga, na mwanga ni aina ya mionzi. Picha inayofuata inaonyesha atomu zikitoa fotoni. Kwa hakika, katika hali halisi fotoni ni ndogo zaidi kuliko zile zilizo kwenye picha. Fotoni ni ndogo hata kuliko vitu vinavyotengeneza atomu!"
mt: "To return to their original state of energy, they must give up excess energy gained from the light. They do this by emitting tiny particles of light called "photons." Scientists call this process "stimulated emission" because the atom is stimulated by intense light to emit photons, and light is a form of energy. The following picture shows atoms emitting photons. In reality, photons are smaller than the atoms that produce them!"
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: Baada ya mamia ya saa za operesheni, hatimaye uzi wa balbu unaungua na balbu ya nuru haiwezi kufanya kazi tena. Balbu ya mwanga basi inahitaji kubadilishwa. Ni muhimu kuwa na uangalifu wakati wa kuibadilisha balbu ya mwanga. Kwanza, swichi ya taa nyepesi inahitaji kuzimwa au waya kutengwa. Hii ni kwa sababu umeme unaopita ndani ya soketi ambamo sehemu ya metali ya balbu hukaa unaweza kukupa mshtuko mkubwa wa umeme ukikugusa sehemu ya ndani ya soketi ama sehemu ya metali ya balbu ikiwa bado ina sehemu iliyobakia kwenye tundu.
mt: After thousands of hours of operation, the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs to be replaced. It is important to be careful when replacing a light bulb. First, the switch of the lamp needs to be turned off or the plug unplugged. This is because the current passing through the socket where the metal part of the bulb sits can give you a large shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal part of the bulb if it still has a remaining part on the base.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: Bomu hii gawanyiki hufanya kazi kwa kanuni kwamba nguvu huhitajika katika uundaji wa viini vyenye protoni na nutroni nyingi. Kama vile kuviringisha rukwama nzito kuelekea mlimani. Kugawanya nyuklia mara nyingine tena kisha kutoa baadhi ya nishati hiyo. Atomu zingine huwa na viini visivyo imara kwa maana kwamba huwa na mazoea ya kuachana hata kwa mguso kidogo tu.
mt: This bomb works by the principle that energy is required to assemble nuclei with many protons and neutrons. Like pushing a boulder up a hill. Splitting the nucleus again and releasing some of that energy. Other atoms have unstable nuclei because they have a tendency to split even with a small push.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: Unapompigia simu mtu aliye mbali maelfu ya maili, unatumia satelaiti. Setilaiti iliyo angani hupata simu kisha inaiakisi tena chini, karibu papo hapo. Setalaiti ilitumwa angani kwa kutumia roketi. Wanasayansi hutumia darubini angani kwa sababu anga ya dunia huvuruga sehemu ya nuru na mtazamo wetu. Huhitaji roketi kubwa yenye urefu wa zaidi ya futi 100 kuweka setalaiti au darubini angani.
mt: When you call someone far away, you use satellites. Satellites receive the call and send it back down, close by. Satellites were sent into space using rockets. Scientists use satellites in space because the Earth's atmosphere scatters light and our view. They need a big rocket over 100 feet long to put a satellite or a telescope in space.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: Wakati ni kitu ambacho kinatuzingira, na huathiri kila kitu tunachofanya, lakini ni ngumu kuelewa. Wakati umesomwa na wasomi wa kidini, kifalsafa, na kisayansi kwa maelfu ya miaka. Sisi hupata saa kama msururu wa matukio unaopita kutoka wakati ujao kupitia wakati uliopo hadi kwenye wakati uliopita. Saa pia ni jinsi tunavyolinganisha kipindi (urefu) cha matukio. Unaweza kuweka alama ya upitaji wa saa wewe mwenyewe kwa kuangalia marudio ya tukio la kimzunguko. Tukio la kimzunguko ni kitu ambacho hutukia tena na tena mara nyingi.
mt: Time is something that surrounds us, and affects everything we do, but it is hard to understand. Time has been taught by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a flow of events from the future through the present to the past. You can set a time stamp yourself by looking at the replay of an event. An event replay is something that happens over and over again many times.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: Kitamaduni, mrithi wa kiti cha enzi angeenda moja kwa moja kwa uanajeshi baada ya kuhitimu shuleni. Walakini, Charles alienda katika Trinity College, Cambridge mahali alisomea Anthropolojia na Akiolojia, na baadaye Historia, akapokea 2:2 (shahada ya pili kutoka chini). Charles alikuwa memba wa kwanza wa Familia ya Kifalme ya Kiingereza kuzawadiwa shahada ya digrii.
mt: Culture, the heir apparent would have gone straight into the military after leaving school. However, Charles went to Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, receiving a 2:2 (a second class degree from below). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a doctorate.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: Uingereza ilikuwa na uzoefu wa kipindi kirefu cha amani baada ya kushinda upya Danelaw. Walakini mnamo 991 Ethelred alikabiliwa na kundi la manowari la Viking kubwa kuliko lolote tangu la Guthrum karne moja mapema. Manowari hizi ziliongozwa na Olaf Trygvasson, Mnorwei aliye na matarajio ya kurudisha nchi yake kutoka kwa utawala wa Kidenmaki. Baada ya vipingamizi vya kwanza vya kijeshi, Ethelred aliweza kukubaliana kimasharti na Olaf, ambaye alirudi Norwe ili kujaribu kupata ufalme wake, kwa mafanikio mseto.
mt: 991 England had a long period of peace after defeating the Danelaw. However, in 991 Ethelred was confronted by a large Viking fleet, the largest since Guthrum's fleet a century earlier. These ships were led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian who had ambitions to regain his country from Danish rule. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to negotiate a truce with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to regain his throne, with limited success.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: "Karibu karne ya 15, Estonia kaskazini ilikuwa chini ya ushawishi mkubwa wa kiutamaduni wa Ujerumani. Watawa wengine wa Kijerumani walitaka kumleta Mungu karibu na watu asili, kwa hivyo wakabuni lugha halisi ya Kiestonia Ilihusishwa na alfabeti ya kijerumani na alfabeti moja ""Õ/õ"" ikaongezwa. Kadiri muda ulivyopita, maneno mengi yaliyoombwa kutoka Ujerumani yalichanganyika. Huu ulikuwa mwanzo wa uelewa."
mt: 15th century, northern Estonia was under strong cultural influence of Germany. Other Germanic tribes wanted to bring God closer to the original people, so they baptized the true Estonian language. It was influenced by the German alphabet and one letter ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words were mixed in. This was the beginning of understanding.
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: Kuna makadirio yanayotofautiana kuhusu idadi ya watu wanaozungumza Kihindi. Inakadiriwa kuwa kati ya lugha nambari mbili na nne inayozungumzwa zaidi duniani. Idadi ya wazungumzaji wenyeji hutofautiana kulingana na kama lahaja zinazohusiana kwa karibu sana zinahesabiwa au la. Makadirio yanafikia wasemaji milioni 340 hadi milioni 500, na watu wengi kama milioni 800 wanaweza kuielewa lugha hiyo. Kihindi na Kiurdu zinafanana kwa msamiati lakini tofauti katika hati; katika mazungumzo ya kila siku, wazungumzaji wa lugha zote mbili wanaweza kuelewana.
mt: There are differing estimates about the number of people who speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether dialects closely related to each other are counted or not. Estimates range from 340 to 500 million speakers, and up to 800 million people may be able to understand it. Hindi and Urdu are similar in script but differ in vocabulary; in daily conversation, speakers of both languages can understand each other.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: Hangeul ndiyo alfabeti ya kipekee iliyovumbuliwa kimakusudi inayotumika kimaarufu kila siku. Alfabeti hiyo ilivumbuliwa mwaka wa 1444 wakati wa utawala wa Mfalme Sejong (1418 – 1450). Mfalme Sejong alikua ndiye mfalme wa nne kwenye Nasaba ya Joseon na ndiye aliyezingatiwa Zaidi. Mwanzoni aliipatia alfabeti ya Hangeul jina la Hunmin Jeongeum, kumaanisha “sauti sahihi za maagizo kwa watu”.
mt: Hangeul is a specially created alphabet that is used every day. This alphabet was created in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon dynasty and was the most important. At first he gave the alphabet of Hangeul the name of Hunmin Jeongeum, meaning “correct sounds for the instruction of the people”.
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: Kuna nadharia nyingi kuhusu vile Sanskrit ilikuja kuwepo. Mojawapo ni kuhusu uhamaji wa Aryan kutoka magharibi hadi India waliokuja na lugha yao. Sanskrit ni lugha ya kale na inaweza kulinganishwa na lugha ya Kilatini inayozungumzwa Uropa. Kitabu cha mapema zaidi kijulikanacho duniani kiliandikwa kwa Sanskrit. Baada ya utungaji wa Upanishads, Sanskrit ilififia tu kwa sababu ya mfumo wa viwango. Sanskrit ni lugha tata na tajiri sana, ambayo imekuwa chanzo cha lugha nyingi za kisasa za Kihindi, kama vile Kilatini ilivyo chanzo cha lugha za Kizungu kama vile Kifaransa na Kispanya.
mt: There are many theories about how Sanskrit came to be. One is about the Aryan migration from the west to India bringing their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and can be compared to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The oldest book known in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the Upanishads were written, Sanskrit declined due to the system of declensions. Sanskrit is a dead and rich language, which has been the source of many modern languages of the Indo-European family, such as Latin is the source of the Romance languages such as French and Spanish.
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: Kuna nadharia nyingi kuhusu vile Sanskrit ilikuja kuwepo. Mojawapo ni kuhusu uhamaji wa Aryan kutoka magharibi hadi India waliokuja na lugha yao. Sanskrit ni lugha ya kale na inaweza kulinganishwa na lugha ya Kilatini inayozungumzwa Uropa. Kitabu cha mapema zaidi kijulikanacho duniani kiliandikwa kwa Sanskrit. src: Mvuto wa lo ungewezaje kunivuta? Kama ungesimama katika uso wa lo, ungekuwa na uzani mdogo kuliko ulionao duniani. Mtu aliye na uzito wa pauni 200 (kilogramu 90) duniani anaweza kuwa na uzito wa pauni 36 (kilogramu 16) kwenye lo. Kwa hivyo mvuto, bila shaka, huvuta kidogo sana kwako.
mt: 1. How much would you weigh on the moon? If you stood on the moon, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90 kilograms) on Earth would weigh 36 pounds (16 kilograms) on the moon. So, gravity pulls you less strongly there.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: Uso wa mwezi umeundwa kwa mawe na vumbi. Safu ya nje ya mwezi hujulikana kama ganda. Uso wa dunia una upana wa karibu kilomita 70 kwa ukaribu na upana wa kilomita100 kwa umbali. Chini ya maria huwa nyembamba lakini nzito chini ya nyanda za juu. Kunaweza kuwa na maria zaidi upande wa karibu kwa sababu ganda huwa jembamba. Ilikuwa rahisi kwa lava kupanda juu hadi usoni.
mt: The moon's surface is made of rock and craters. The outer layer of the moon is called the regolith. The moon's diameter is about 70 kilometers near and 100 kilometers far. It is thin under the maria but thick under the highlands. There may be more maria near the moon because the regolith is thin. It would be easy for lava to rise up to the surface.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: Watu wengi huota kuhusu siku ambayo wanadamu wanaweza kusafiri kwa nyota nyingine na kuvumbua ulimwengu mwingine. Watu wengine hushangaa ni nini iko huko nje, wengine wanaamini kuwa wageni au maisha mengine yanaweza kuishi kwenye sayari nyingine. Lakini, iwapo hili litawahi kutokea labda halitatokea kwa muda mrefu sana. Nyota zimetawanyika sana kiasi kwamba kuna matrilioni ya maili katikati ya nyota ambazo ni “majirani”. Pengine siku moja, vitukuu wako watasimama juu ya ulimwengu wa kigeni wakiwaza kuhusu mababu zao wa zamani?
mt: Many people wonder about the day when humans will travel to other stars and discover other worlds. Some wonder what aliens or other life forms might live on other planets. But if this ever happens, it will not happen for a very long time. The stars are so far apart that there are trillions of miles between neighboring stars. Maybe one day, your descendants will stand on another world and wonder about their ancestors?
ref: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: Jua halina ganda gumu kama Dunia ambayo unaweza kusimama kwayo. Jua zima limetengenezwa kwa gesi, moto, na gesi ya utegili. Gesi huwa nyembamba kadiri unavyosonga mbali na Jua. Sehemu ya nje tunayoona tunapotazama jua inaitwa photosphere, kumaanisha “mpira wa mwanga”.
mt: The Sun is not as complex as the Earth, which you can stand on. The Sun is made of gas, fire, and plasma. Gas is thin as you move away from the Sun. The part of the outside we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, meaning “sphere of light”.
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: Jua halina ganda gumu kama Dunia ambayo unaweza kusimama kwayo. Jua zima limetengenezwa kwa gesi, moto, na gesi ya utegili. Gesi huwa nyembamba kadiri unavyosonga mbali na Jua. Sehemu ya nje tunayoona tunapotazama jua inaitwa photosphere, kumaanisha “mpira wa mwanga”.
mt: The Sun is not as complex as the Earth, which you can stand on. The Sun is made of gas, fire, and plasma. Gas is thin as you move away from the Sun. The part of the outside we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, meaning “sphere of light”.
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: Takribani miaka elfu tatu baadaye, mnamo 1610, Mnajimu Muitaliano Galileo Galilei alitumia darubini kuangalia kwamba Zuhura ina awamu, kama vile mwezi. Awamu hufanyika kwa sababu tu upande wa Zuhura (au wa Mwezi) unaoegemea upande wa Jua hupata mwanga. Awamu za Zuhura ziliunga mkono nadharia ya Kopernikasi kwamba sayari zinazunguka Jua. Kisha, miaka michache baadaye mwaka wa 1639, mnajimu Mwingereza aliyeitwa Jeremiah Horrocks alitazama safari ya Venus.
mt: 3,000 years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus had phases, like the moon. Phases of Venus supported the Copernican theory that planets orbit the sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, English astronomer Jeremiah Horrocks observed the transit of Venus.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: Mto wa Amazon ndiyo mto wa pili kwa urefu na kubwa zaidi Duniani. Inachukua maji zaidi ya mara 8 kama mto wa pili mkubwa. Amazon pia ni mto mpana zaidi Duniani, wakati mwingine maili sita kwa upana. Asilimia 20 kamili ya maji ambayo yanatoka kwenye mito ya sayari kuenda ndani ya bahari hutoka kwenye Amazoni. Mto mkuu wa Amazon una kilomita 6,387 (maili 3,980). Hukusanya maji kutoka maelfu ya mito midogo.

ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: Asilimia kumi na nane ya Wavenezuela hawana ajira, na wengi wa wale walioajiriwa hufanya kazi katika sekta isiyo rasmi. Thuluthi mbili ya Wavenezuela ambao hufanya kazi hufanya hivyo katika sekta ya huduma, karibu robo yao hufanya kazi katika viwanda na humusi hufanya kazi katika kilimo. Sekta muhimu kwa Wavenezuela ni mafuta, ambapo nchi hiyo ni wauzaji nje, ingawa ni asilimia moja tu wanaofanya kazi katika sekta ya mafuta.
mt: 18% of Venezuelans are unemployed, and many of those who are employed work in the informal sector. Two-thirds of Venezuelans who work work in the service sector, about half work in manufacturing, and about one-third work in agriculture. The most important sector for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is an exporter, although only 1% work in the oil sector.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

src: Nyota hutoa mwangaza na joto kwa sababu ya nishati inayotengenezwa wakati atomu za hidrojeni zinapochanganywa (au kuunganishwa) pamoja ili kuunda elementi nzito. Wanasayansi wanashugulika kuunda tanuri la kinyuklia ambalo linaweza kutengeneza nishati kwa njia hiyo hiyo. Hii, hata hivyo, ni shida ngumu sana kutatua na itachukua miaka mingi kabla ya matanuri ya kufaa ya kinyuklia kuundwa.
mt: The star gives off light and heat because of the energy released when hydrogen atoms are fused (or combined) together to form a heavier element. Scientists are working to build a nuclear reactor that can produce energy in that way. However, this is a very difficult problem to solve and it will take many years before viable nuclear reactors are built.
ref: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

src: Elementi na misombo zinaweza kusonga kutoka hali moja hadi nyingine na zikose kubadilika. Nitrojeni kama gesi bado ina sifa sawa na nitrojeni oevu. Hali oevu nzito kiasi lakini molekyuli bado ni sawa. Maji ni mfano mwingine. Msombo maji umeundwa kwa atomu mbili za hidrojeni na atomu moja ya oksijeni. Ina muundo sawa wa kimolekyuli iwe ni gesi, kioevu, au mango. Ingawa hali yake ya mwili inaweza kubadilika, hali yake ya kikemikali inabaki ile ile.
mt: Elements and compounds can change from one state to another and change in form. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as nitrogen as a liquid. The liquid state is denser but the molecular structure is the same. Water is another example. Water molecules are made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state can change, its chemical state remains the same.
ref: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.

src: Wakati wa Vita vya Mapinduzi, majimbo kumi na matatu kwanza yaliunda serikali dhaifu ya kati – huku Bunge la Marekani likiwa ndiyo sehemu yake pekee – chini ya Vifungu vya Shirikisho. Kongamano lilikosa uwezo wowote wa kuweka ushuru, na, kwa sababu hakukuwa na mtendaji wa kitaifa au mahakama, lilitegemea mamlaka ya taifa, ambao mara nyingi hawakuwa na ushirikiano, kutekeleza sheria zake. Pia haikuwa na mamlaka ya kupuuza sheria na orodha za ushuru kati ya majimbo. Vifungu vilihitaji ridhaa ya pamoja kutoka kwa majimbo yote kabla ya kurekebishwa na majimbo yalichukulia serikali kuu kwa mzaha sana kiasi kwamba mara nyingi wawakilishi wao hawakuwepo.
mt: 13 original states formed a weak central government – with the United States Congress being its only national institution – under the Articles of Confederation. The Articles lacked any taxing power, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, the states often failed to enforce their provisions. It also lacked the power to nullify or repeal any of its own laws. The Articles required unanimous approval from all states before any amendments could be made, and states often treated the central government with such contempt that their representatives were often absent.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

The Articles required unanimous approval from all states before any amendments could be made, and states often treated the central government with such contempt that their representatives were often absent.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: Iwapo umetazama sinema ya Hazina ya Kitaifa, huenda ukafikiri ramani ya hazina iliandikwa nyuma ya Tangazo la Uhuru. Hata hivyo, hilo si kweli. Ingawa kuna kitu kilichoandikwa nyuma ya hati, si ramani ya hazina. Nyuma ya Tangazo la Uhuru kuliandikwa maneno “Tangazo halisi la Uhuru la tarehe 4 Julai 1776”. Maandishi hayo yako katika sehemu ya chini ya hati, juu chini. Wakati hakuna anayejua kwa hakika ni nani aliyeiandika, inajulikana kwamba hati hiyo kubwa ya ngozi (ina vipimo vya inchi 29¾ kwa inchi 24½) ilikunjwa kwa uhifadhi. Kwa hivyo, kuna uwezekano kuwa nukuu liliongezwa liwe kama ishara.
mt: If you have seen the movie National Treasure, you may have thought the map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, this is not true. Although something was written on the back of the document, it was not a map. Written on the bottom of the Declaration is the phrase “The Unanimous Declaration of the Thirteen United States of America.” These words are at the bottom of the document. When no one knows for sure who wrote it, it is called an annotation.
ref: "If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words ""Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776"". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down. While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label."

src: Mapema katika uhuru wa nchi, utaalamu wa Singapori katika Bustani za Mimea uliisaidia katika kukigeuza kisiwa hicho kuwa Mji wa Bustani wa kitropiki. Mnamo 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, okidi mseto, lilichaguliwa kama ua la kitaifa la nchi hiyo.
mt: In the early days of independence, Singapore's expertise in agriculture helped transform the island into a tropical garden city. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, a hybrid orchid, was chosen as the country's national flower.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: Ingawa ujenzi wa piramidi kwa mawe uliendelea hadi mwishoni mwa Ufalme Mzee, piramidi za Giza hazikuwahi kupitwa katika saizi yazo na ubora wa kiufundi wa ujenzi wazo. Wamisri wa kale wa Ufalme mpya walishangazwa na minara ya watangulizi wao, ambayo ilikuwa wakati huo na zaidi ya miaka elfu.
mt: While construction of the pyramids continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza have not been surpassed in size or the quality of their construction. The ancient Egyptians of the New Kingdom were amazed by the obelisks of their predecessors, which were at the time over a thousand years old.
ref: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction. New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.

src: Kila mwaka karibu Oktoba wala-mimea milioni 1.5 husafiri kuelekea nyanda za kusini, na kuvuka Mto Mara, kutoka vilima vya kaskazini kwa ajili ya mvua. Kisha tena kurudi kaskazini kupitia magharibi, na kuvuka mto Mara mara nyingine tena, baada ya mvua karibu Aprili. Eneo la Serengeti lina Mbuga la Kitaifa la Serengeti, Eneo la Uhifadhi la Ngorongoro na Hifadhi ya Wanyamapori ya Maswa katika Tanzania na Hifadhi ya Kitaifa ya Maasai Mara katika Kenya.
mt: 1.5 million wildebeest migrate southwards every year around October, crossing the Mara River, from the northern highlands for rain. Then again return northwards through the west, crossing the Mara River again, after rain around April. The Serengeti National Park, Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.
ref: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

src: "Vita kwa Ufaransa vikiwa vimekwisha, Ujerumani ilianza kujitayarisha kuvamia kisiwa cha Uingereza. Ujerumani ililipa shambulio jina lililosimbwa la ""Operation Sealion"". Silaha nyingi nzito na vifaa vya Jeshi la Uingereza vilikuwa vimepotea wakati wa kutoka Dunkirk, kwa hivyo jeshi lilikuwa dhaifu kiasi. Lakini Nevi ya Kifalme bado ilikuwa imara sana zaidi ya Nevi ya Ujerumani (""Kriegsmarine"") na ingeweza kuangamiza kikosi chochote cha ushambuliaji kilichotumwa katika Mlango-bahari wa Uingereza. Kwa hali yoyote, ni meli chache sana za jeshi la kifalme zilizo karibu na njia za uvamizi kwa sababu wanahofia kusamishwa na mashambulizi ya hewa ya Kijerumani."
mt: "When the war for France was over, Germany began to prepare to invade the island of Britain. Germany paid the price of the name ""Operation Sealion"". Many heavy weapons and equipment of the British Army had disappeared when leaving Dunkirk, so the army was weak. But the Royal Navy was still stronger than the German Navy (""Kriegsmarine"") and could have destroyed any attacking force in the English Channel. In any case, there were few German ships near the invasion routes because they feared being attacked by German air raids."
ref: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.

src: Hebu tuanze na maelezo kuhusu mipango ya Italia. Italia ilikuwa hasa “kaka mdogo” wa Ujerumani na Japani. Ilikuwa na jeshi dhaifu na nevi dhaifu, ingawa walikuwa wamejenga tu meli nne mpya kabla ya kuanza kwa vita. Malengo makuu ya Italiano yalikuwa nchi za Kiafrika. Ili kunasa nchi hizo, walihitaji kuwa na pedi ya kurushia vikosi, ili vikosi viweze kusafiri katika Bahari ya Mediteranea na kuishambulia Afrika. Kwa hayo, walihitaji kuondoa kambi na meli za Uingereza kutoka Misri. Zaidi ya hatua hizo, manowari za Italia hazikupaswa kufanya lingine lolote. Sasa kwa Japani. Japani ilikuwa nchi ya kisiwa, kama vile Uingereza.
mt: Let us begin with the Italian plans. Italy was mainly the “little brother” of Germany and Japan. It had a weak army and navy, although they had built only four new ships before the war began. Their main goal was African countries. To conquer these countries, they needed two fleets, so that the fleets could sail in the Mediterranean Sea and attack Africa. For this, they had to remove the British camp and ships from Egypt. In addition to these steps, Italian ships were not allowed to do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, like Britain.
ref: "Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the ""little brother"" of Germany and Japan. It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war. Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain."

src: "Utuaji siku ya shambulio na mapigano yaliyofuata yalikuwa yameweka huru kaskazini mwa Ufaransa, lakini kusini bado haikuwa huru. Ilitawaliwa na Wafaransa wa “Vichy”. Hawa walikuwa watu wa Ufaransa ambao walikuwa wamefanya amani na Wajerumani mnamo 1940 na kufanya kazi na washambulizi badala ya kupigana nao. Mnamo Agosti 15 1940, Majeshi ya Kirafiki yalishambulia Ufaransa kusini, shambulio liliitwa ""Operesheni Dragoon"". Kwa kipindi cha majuma mawili tu vikosi vya Marekani na Ufaransa Huru vilikuwa vimekomboa Ufaransa kusini na vilikuwa vikielekea Ujerumani."
mt: "The invasion and subsequent fighting had freed northern France, but the south was still occupied. It was controlled by the "Vichy" French, who were French who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them. On August 15, 1940, Allied forces invaded southern France, the invasion was called "Operation Dragoon". In two weeks American and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were moving towards Germany."
ref: "The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free. It was ruled by the ""Vichy"" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them. On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called ""Operation Dragoon"". In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany."

src: Sabmarini ni meli zilizoundwa kusafiri chini ya maji, na kubaki hapo kwa muda mrefu. Nyambizi zilitumiwa katika vita vya pili vya dunia. Wakati huo zilisonga polepole sana na zilikuwa na masafa mafupi sana ya upigaji risasi. Mwanzoni mwa vita zilisonga mara nyingi juu ya bahari, lakini kadiri rada ilivyoanza kukua na kupata usahihi zaidi nyambizi zililazimika kuzama chini ya maji ili kuepuka kuonekana. Manowari za Ujerumani ziliitwa nyambizi. Wajerumani walikuwa wazuri sana kwa kuabiri na kuendesha manowari zao. Kwa sababu ya mafanikio yao na nyambizi, baada ya vita Wajerumani hawaaminiki kuwa na nyingi zazo.
mt: Submarines are ships designed to operate underwater, and stay there for long periods of time. During World War II they were used in limited numbers and moved very slowly and had short ranges. At the beginning of the war they moved frequently on the surface, but as radar improved and became more accurate submarines were forced to submerge to avoid detection. German submarines were called U-boats. The Germans were very good at naming and operating their submarines. Because of their success and submarines, after the war the Germans were not allowed to have any more.
ref: Submarines are ships designed to travel underwater, and remain there for an extended amount of time. Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. Back then they were very slow and had a very limited shooting range. In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen. German submarines were called U-Boats. The Germans were very good at navigating and operating their submarines. Because of their success with submarines, after the war Germans aren't trusted to have many of them.

src: Kufikia Septemba 17, 1939, ulinzi wa Kipolishi ulivunjwa, na tumaini la pekee lilikuwa kurudi na kujipanga tena kwa darajakuu la Kiromania. Hata hivyo, mipango hii ilipitwa na wakati usiku mmoja, wakati zaidi ya askari 800,000 kutoka Jeshi Jekundu la Umoja wa Kisovyeti lilipoingia na kuunda mipaka ya Belarusiani na Ukreini baada ya kuvamia maeneo ya mashariki mwa Polandi kwa kukiuka Mkataba wa Amani wa Riga, Mapatano ya Kisovyeti-Polishi Yasiyo ya Uchokozi, na mikataba mingine ya kimataifa, pande mbili na pande nyingi.
mt: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense had been broken, and the only hope was to retreat and regroup on the Romanian side. However, this plan was foiled by the night, when more than 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet Red Army had entered and established the border between Belarus and Ukraine after crossing the eastern part of Poland by violating the Riga Peace Treaty, the Non-Aggression Pact between the Soviet Union and Poland, and other international agreements, both sides and many others.
ref: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead. However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral.
